name: Fergana Parking Lot
description: Parking lot, next to Central Park. Only quiet at night (23 till 6 o’clock)

name: Bushcamp Museum
description: Bushcamp near museum at Konye-Urgench. Toilet at the museum, no shower.

name: Hotel Jipek Joli
description: Very clean hotel with secure parking. Price is 55 USD per night including breakfast. Room has airco and wifi. Hotel gives registration slip.

name: Bushcamp Viewpoint - Ship Cemetary, Monyaq
description: Bushcamp at viewpoint in Moynaq. Nice view over the dry Aral sea and old rusty ships. No facilities

name: Arkanchi Hotel
description:
Camping on parking of Arkanchi Hotel in Khiva. Camping costs 40.000 som per night for parking, shower and toilet. You get a room.

Edit: now 10$ p.p.

name: Madina Bed and Breakfast
description: Clean room. Run by a very friendly Iranian lady. Wifi, airco and tv in the room. Price 15 USD per person per night including breakfast. Location near to the old center.

name: Bahodir Bed and Breakfast
description: Camping in the street in front of Bahodir Bed and Breakfast in Samarkand. Overlanders place. Price 8 USD per person for shower, toilet and breakfast. You get a room for little bit more. Free wifi.

name: Gas Station
description: Diesel at gas station in Tortkol

name: Aral Sea Museum
description:
"Karakalpak State Museum"
Aral Sea museum in Moynaq next to main road, right beside the theatre.

name: Workshop
description: Oil change in Samarkand. Good service

name: Ship Wrecks
description:
Ship wrecks in sand of the (former) Aral Sea. 

The ships are put together in a row, so not in any original state or so. And the rust really does its work!

name: Tire Shop
description: Tire shops in Samarkand

name: Border Post
description: Nice border, we need only 2 hours to pass, no bribe, no money, no problems a lot longer and much to pay coming from the other side

name: Master Yarash
description:
Advised by someone in Khiva as good mechanic.
Almost next to Mann trucks

name: No idea about name
description: We were directed to this master by local mechanics. They have a lathe and were able to make spare ball bearing for our direction in 2hrs. We had to get then done since no spare exist in the country for our car (Daihatsu Feroza)

name: Furkat hotel
description:
Amazing place. Splendid roof terrace with view, clean rooms, lavish breakfast.
Got it for 90$ for 3 nights.

name: Insurance Nukus
description: Cheap, quick, at least sometimes somebody speaks english

name: Sentyab
description: wild camping next to spring-fed cristal clear lake.

name: Rumi's hostel
description: Nice family run hostel. offers wifi, shower, toilet, and laundry machines. for 5$ per person. including registration off course.

name: Car Insurance Xiva
description:
Insurance is now 40.000 som for 2 weeks (04.2019)

Behind supermarket and up the stairs!

name: Isiqlol hotel
description: Stayed again on way to Tashkent- do not take room 26.  It stinks

name: Valentina's guest house (see maps.me for contact details)
description: Staying at Valentina's flat in the city.  She provides registration and a room for $30 per couple (or $15 each).  Cheaper than the 4 hotels in town.  Well located near Sunday Supermarket and Emirates Cafe.

name: Hotel in Samarkand (5km from old town)
description: Directed here by city hostel owner as vehicle is more secure here.  Room was ok but cold and smokey from other guests nearby.  $25 for 2 persons incl breakfast

name: Hotel Dosliq
description: Nice hotel.  They have foreigner rates in usd but use the government exchange (3086 som when we were there) so better value than it would appear.  We paid 149,000 som or $23 usd pn for a very clean twin room with bath and shower incl breakfast.

name: Diesel
description: I filtered my fuel,  but it seemed clean for a twin filtered Landcruiser.

name: Rizo Hotel Bukhara
description: Spanking brand new, really clean rooms and just lovely family run place.  Breakfast surpasses anything we've had elsewhere and recommend having the plov for dinner (20,000 som each) - so tasty and you get to eat with the family.  We paid $20 for a double - this may be their opening special.  If you have a vehicle you can park about 30m away by his family home.

name: Burchmullo
description: Some sort of campground/picnic area on a meadow with trees at the shore of the lake. Simple toilets available. Great place for swimming. The campground owner rents out boats. Should be around 50'000 som per night.

name: Bulungur
description: Diesel available for 3.500 SOM

name: guest house Alibek
description: near the west port, we stand  next of the guest house,  we made a deal for standing, using shower, wifi and breckfast. including registration for 8 dollar p.p. we were sleaping in our own car

name: Osh Dostuk Port of Entry
description: You have to pay a environmental tax of 1000 in local currency. Change some money in between borders - if not you will be charged extra for changing.

name: To dako'l_Beach
description: beautiful beach, sweet water, shadow, payded 50.000 som pro night 2 persons

name: river wild camp
description: This spot close to the river is relatively quiet and about 14 km from nukus. Spent 2 days and 2 nights waiting for Western Union here. Heard people swimming, but seen none. Wood for fire around.

name: Irgashev's guesthouse
description:
Good value for the money. We paid $50 for three nights in a basic but very clean double with A/C. Very nice owners that speak English and will help with money exchanges. Off-street parking for your vehicle. Lots of restaurants nearby. But the city center is a half an hour walk. Our just take a taxi for 2000 soms per person. 
There is no sign with the hotel name on the street, but a big one with the address of the guesthouse "Lakhutiy 135".

name: Black Market gas station
description:
House with a brown double door on the right side of the street. Look for guys with plastic bottles and funnels. We paid 50$ for 80 liters of petrol (we think it was 91).

If you can't find them ask on the gas station that is on the same street.

 They take dollars (post 2004) and som.

name: Gas station
description: Black market spot, right beside the proper gas station with the blue and white roof. They have petrol and diesel, 5000 som per liter.

name: Sunrise Caravan Stay
description:
13 US dollar, dorm including breakfast. Okay to sleep in the car. 
clean and tidy. friendly staff.
Place for three-four cars.
quiet and safe area. goes to Park on the Street with large vehicles.

name: Black market petrol and diesel
description: Kind of established venue. It's also on OpenStreetMap. When we arrived, the taxi drivers sitting at the corner already asked if we wanted diesel. 4000 som per liter.

name: Truck stop
description: Truck stop with a restaurant. Look for the parking lot covered with gravel behind the buildings. Highway is audible but not annoying.

name: Sayyoh hotel
description: Small hotel. We had a 2 pax room for 50 usd a night. Includes WiFi, breakfast, shower, toilet and parking. Owner delivered us 60 liter of diesel from the black market at 4500 som a liter.

name: Club hotel 777
description: We stayed at the parking of the hotel. Payed 70.000 som for swimming pool, shower, toilet and WiFi. Close by are some bars and restaurants.

name: Black Market Gas Station (DONT GO HERE)
description:
UPDATE: DONT BUY GAS HERE. We got 40 liters of petrol here and they turned out to be watered down crap.


Black market petrol available on this street. Payed 4000 som per liter of benzin.

name: New fuel station with Diesel
description: On the highway from Bukhara to Urgench. Seemed to be clean, 4200 som per liter.

name: Workshop
description:
They fixed our broken air intake tube. 50000 som for a few hours of work.

No english spoken whatsoever but they are quite friendly and are happy to help.

name: Dinur TIR Stop
description: TIR stop, free shower and toilet. Restaurant with wi-fi. Petrol and diesel avaliable but expensive.

name: Shade
description:
Wild camping with shade. Loads of trees and close by the nicest fort of all, but that's subjective. 

Any way, we enjoyed it here. Pretty tranquil. 4WD needed to get closer to the trees, a small bit of soft sand crossing. Maybe there is a way around that, but we didn't see it.

Enjoy

name: Diesel station
description: Diesel at a shabby station.  No idea how clean.

name: flat steppe wild site
description: Drive into a little sand track. After about 500 meters a flat depression appears in the right. Animals around. Great for some pictures. Goats or cows may pass by.

name: Diesel station
description: Got diesel here for 4100 som

name: Yangiabad hostel
description:
Ski resort and hostel at the end of the road near Yangiabad. An amazing family runs this place. Hiking trails into the mountains start from here. Waterfalls and old uranium mines near. 
You can also camp on the parking place.

name: between the medows
description: Perfect flat empty spot between the medows. A bit hard to find. Other spots hard to find because everything is used for grain. From the village head south into dirt road next to a stream in a concrete duct. Locals are super friendly.

name: Black market fuel
description:
If the only fuel station in town (see location on map) is closed/out of fuel, this guy sells fuel and diesel by the bottle. It is a private house, just ask at the gate. We paid 5000 som per liter of diesel. 
For information there is no fuel station until Kazakhstan (~30km after crossing the border)

name: Fuel station
description:
It looks like this is the only fuel station in town, anything else is gaz 'LPG/CNG'.
The station was out of fuel/diesel, hope you are more lucky! If not check 'black market fuel' a few I'm away on the ioverlander map.

name: Fort Ayaz-Qala
description: We stayed up the hill right next to the fort overlooking the the plains. Nice place with great views for sunset and sunrise. Very quiet, there is a yurt camp down the hill but no-one bothered. The nearby lake is dried up. The road to get here from Beruni and Boston is paved all the way. The fort is free.

name: Fuel and diesel
description: This is the first petrol station we found with available fuel and diesel since we crossed the border from Kazakhstan. 4200 sum per liter of diesel.

name: Fuel station with diesel
description:
This petrol station had diesel available.
A couple of trucks were refueling.

name: Khiva - west gate
description:
Main gate with the ticket office. 
Price is 100'000 sum since 2018 for all sights (excepted the minarets, mausoleum, tower) valid for 2 days.

name: Well located parking
description:
Very good location near the point of interests. We paid 5000 sum per day and slept in our van.
Public toilet available 100 meters away.

name: Water spring
description: This spring is along the highway, everyone stops here to refill their bottle and drink the water.

name: Bazar to change money
description: You can change Dollar to So'm here. 1 Dollar = 8000 So'm. At the flower stand, just ask the people at the stands.

name: Ratmina Hotel
description: We checked three other hotels. Tashkent was closed, Dosliq was 50 dollar but very unfriendly, Asem was 60 Dollar. Ratmina is 50 Dollar for a double. Room okay, wifi okay, with breakfast. Helpful at the reception. They do registration.

name: Café
description: First café after border. Car can be parked there for the night, lots of Trucks.

name: Dinur Hotel
description: We went there to eat but it is a hotel too, owner was very nice and speaks English.

name: Petrol station with diesel
description: The gate was closed with a rope but actually they were open and had diesel available from the pump at 4000 sum per liter.

name: Diesel and petrol
description: Fuel station with diesel from the pump at 4500 sum per liter.

name: Uzbekistan-Tajikistan border
description:
Denov - Tursunzoda border
There were only 4 trucks in front of us but I still took more than 4 hours for the full border crossing with our van, most of it for exiting Uzbekistan. Nothing to pay in Uzbekistan. Nobody asked about the registration slips. Entering Tajikistan was quick, passport stamp, customs document for the car, road taxe to be paid. You get an official receipt for it. Bike 10usd, small  car 25usd, van/4x4 45usd. Car document only valid for 15 days. Apparently possible to extend it in customs office in Dushanbe.

name: Alskom insurance
description: We did there our Uzbek insurance for our car. it worked for the exit border. Pages 10000 som.

name: Daewoo official
description: nice mechanic. There is one pit, one lift and a third park. he found our problems in 1 minute and fix it very fast.

name: Asaka Bank
description: Its possible to get money at this ATM, maximum of $ 60 each time. You can use your Maestro and MasterCard. They don't take cash Manat from Turkmenistan. Visa card is not possible.

name: Black market benzine, Bukhara
description: Black market benzine. 4000 som a liter. Benzine is hard to find or there are long lines.

name: Hotel Jipek Joli Inn
description: Sister hotel to Jipek Joli.  Nice rooms.  $50 a room but in the end we got 3 rooms for $80 plus registration taxes.  Doesn't seem to be anything cheaper in Nukus.

name: Black Market Petrol & Diesel
description: While stopped at the stop sign when passing Zhaslyk we got offered benzin (10,000 UZS/L) and diesel (5,000 UZS/L). Not sure about the quality yet, but he assured us it comes from Kazakhstan.

name: Spectacular view from the city wall
description: You can pay for panoramas from the towers, or climb the city wall at the north gate and walk all the way to the west gate for free.

name: Desert Camp
description: Lots of places to pull off near the border.  It's really flat so still visible from the road but quiet. No facilities. Free.

name: Private sale
description: Shady benzine from the trunk of an old Lada. A local directed me to this place when I was standing at the closed petrol station to the west. Two guys were selling petrol to locals from water jugs, although they seemed to be siphoning it from their own car in between sales. Some rust flakes float around in it, so I'm saving it as a last resort. 18,000 UZS for 5 L.

name: Fuel station with petrol and diesel
description: Petrol (80) at 3,000 UZS per liter, diesel 4,300 UZS per liter. After coming from Khiva and having filled up here, we saw multiple fuel stations that claimed to have petrol.

name: By a little river 10 km from the A380
description: Nice and quiet place to camp. We saw locals swimming, but didn't swim ourselves. We followed the trail next to the river for a bit to find some cover.

name: Black Market Petrol
description: Sold from the green container by the side of the road. Looks clean. 6,000 UZS per liter.

name: Water spring
description: Unfortunately, we bought water in Samarkand, because there are multiple water springs in the hills between there and Shakhrisabz. Locals fill up here as well, so it should be good to drink.

name: Petrol station
description: One of the last ones this side of the border. 80 octane for 3,400 UZS per liter.

name: In the hills 100 km from the border
description: We looked for a place with a bit of cover to spend the night before crossing the border. It took a bit of effort, but this was just that place. Up in the hills, about 12 km from the main road. 4x4 might be useful to get up the hill.

name: Kitob Sayyoh Hotel
description: You sleep in an "oto" (an Uzbek yurt). Great alternative for the expensive hotels in Shakhrisabz. They can arrange your registration for you. 15 USD for a night for the first person, 10 for the second. Breakfast included. Parking within the gate. Very friendly host. Bring small USD notes because they probably won't have change. (Exchange with the money changers at the local bazaar in the afternoon.)

name: In the hills between Nurata and Samarkand
description: It took a bit of work to find a way up to a secluded spot in the hills. Four little goat herders came by on their donkeys, but the rest of the night we had the spot to ourselves.

name: Abdu - Bahodir 2 Hotel
description: Nice place. Close to the Registon. We paid 48 USD for two nights for a double via Booking.com. Parking inside for two cars (maximum height around 2.5 m). Very good breakfast included. The large terrace was our favorite place to relax. Run by the brother of the owner of the Bahodir B&B.

name: On the way to Bukhara
description: They provide diesel at the petrol station. Negotiate about the price before you agree to fill up. We paid 4000 per liter.

name: Russian embassy
description: russian embassy; make an online apointment, it safes time. payment in usd only!

name: Kapital Bank Visa US dollars ATM
description: ATM works with Visa card but gives only out dollars. There is a USD 7,50 fee on ATM usage.

name: Anvar's Guest House
description: Great hostel in Tashkent. Anvar is the owner and speaks great English (11 years living in the USA). Ask for the room with the private sauna!!! $30/night for 2 people. Includes a big breakfast. Parking available in the street and he'll give you the registration for a fee bucks. Small swimming pool in the hotter months. Has heat in the winter months.

name: Rooms
description: OK rooms. $13 for 2 people in 1 room. No WiFi

name: DIESEL Gas Station
description: Finally a place were you can find diesel. We paid 4.500 SOM for 1Liter. The building of the gas station is green and right next to a Propan station.

name: DIESEL Gas Station
description: Diesel - yeah! 5.000 SOM for 1L - price is not negotiable.

name: Benzine
description: Surprised to find petrol for sale here, not sure if we just got lucky or not but if your not finding any ask around here.

name: black market fuel
description: Found Black market fuel here for a decent price

name: National Bank
description: Since 2018 all banks in uzbekistan are exchanging dollars and euros for the black market rate. so 1$ for 8090 som or 1euro for 9000 something. some banks will have atm that give you dollars that you can then exchange but its better to bring your own. the bank in nukus did not have an atm. but no more hassle with black market !!!

name: Sakura Hotel (cheap and nice !)
description:
Sakura Hotel was the cheapest option in town and turned out to be the nicest hotel we stayed at in Uzbekistan. 
This 7 room hotel has all the comfort : nice bedding, private bathroom, small kitchen, heat/AC, breakfast, string wifi. We paid 28$ for 2 people everything included (breakfast registration and city tax). They have smaller rooms too if you are alone around 17$. Everything else was 30$ or more in Ferghana. And they have a front desk so even if you arrive latish you will find someone ! 
The owner is great, speaks really well english and will be happy to share a glass with you. There is a somsa and kebab stand right in front and a minimarket. The entrance is on between the pharmacies. Parking in front in the street but there is space and its a well travelled road.

name: Uzbekneftekgaz
description: struggled to find diesel in january 2018 in bukhara but this gaz station had some at a very good price 4200 som per liter. they also had benzine. yeah !

name: Nigina Hotel
description: Nigina is the cheapest option in town for foreigners. Its not well known but they do registration. Double room with private bathroom, tv, no wifi, no breakfast is 180000 som (22$) for 2 people. Beds and bathroom were clean, carpets could have use a vacuum. Parking in alley way beside the hotel but its a well travel road even at night. everything else was 40$ (althought we were able to get hotel Kokand to 30$ but prefered staying at Nigina). Many restos around, car wash, car parts etc...

name: Ramankha somsa
description:
the best place to try kokand somsa. baked in a woodfired tandir, but thinner crust and less onions than rest of uzbekistan. filled with lamb and caramelized onions and cumin seeds. its right behind a butcher shop so they use the best meat.

come between 10am and 1pm. you wont regret it ! plenty place to park

name: Idyllic wild camp near to a lake
description: Near to these coordinates find a gravel road direction east that leads you into the hills. Found a beautiful quiet spot next to the lake. Cows and goats came along every day but no shepherd. We saw just a few cars driving by. You can do beautiful walkings from here. 2wd ok, just a bit sandy in some places.

name: Ruslan Guest House
description: Nice family owned but unfortunately expensive! No possibilities for parking/camping in front. But if you need they show you a free and save parking. Rooms look clean and food is good. We paid 30$ for 2 persons 1 night including food (3times) after negotiation. Shower is basic! Owner is nice and recommends you spots nearby and can organize it for you.

name: Diesel
description: Diesel for 6000 / 5200 som on petrol station.  Station looks good and new.

name: Parking lot in samarkand
description: Big parking with enough lights but no water and mo toilet.

name: Free parking lots with toilet
description: Free parking lots with toilet-wc and small shops.

name: 5km of the main road
description: nice place to stay when it's not to hot (it's flat and there's no shade). There's a lot of possibilities for camping here, the only one you might run into is a shepherd.

name: Wilcamp at the lake
description: Many nice spots around to camp. We stayed one night, saw nobody. We stayed very close to the main road, just drive a bit further and you won't here the cars passing.

name: Lovely homestay in remote village
description: We stayed with Raxmat and his family for 1 night. It's definitely not cheap, but everything is really nice. $24,- per person including 3 meals. There would be enough space to camp so if you ask them to stay in your own vehicle it might not be a problem and you'll probably pay less. It was very cold when we were there and they heated up the place perfectly. There are many hiking possibilities around. Great place to take a break from sightseeing the cities in Uzbekistan. They do registration.

name: Wild camp between the hills
description: There are a lot of small villages around and unless you drive about 50 kilometer, or more further, it's hard to find a quiet place. This path will lead you into the hills, just pick your spot. We only saw a shepherd in the morning.

name: Toy xona (fish restaurant)
description: A family restaurant where you will find a very kind people. They cook fish very well. You can see fish alives on the entry. A very good uzbek restaurant.

name: Kizil kala
description: Very good for one night. Different littles spots close the fort. Very quiet. Maybie mosquitos in summer, there is a little water way very near.

name: Diesel and benzine
description: The price of the Diesel was 5400 Som/L in March 2018

name: Big flat camp
description: A very very big flat spot. You can camp anywhere. 15-20m high from road. Access by piste (sand way). Nobody in the area. There a lot of another big flat spots in the area. Got stoped in the way to the canyon, just enjoy it. It could be too hot in summer...

name: Green grass camp
description: Very near of Petroglify (5-10 minutes by feet at south). It's a little green grass field with a tree in the behining of the canyon and close at the litle river (goog for one big rig). Very kind and amazing spot, 100% mountain nature, so green in april. Litle bit at north there is a bungalow and yurta hotel with w.c./showers very clean and a good restaurant (8€ per 2 persones for good dishes). If you want, after the petroglify there is a green open valley with any farm, very nice too.

name: Sarmishsoy Petroglify--good location
description: Several Petroglyphs at two sides of the canyon. Maps.me location is inside the bungalow and yurtas hotel (wc, restaurant) 700m at north and you can't visit it... It's very amazing and incredible to see these Petroglyphs from bronze age. And the area is also very amazing, a green canyon with a little river, a very bit of tourists come here (we saw two taxis, 6 tourists at total). Access from little secondary road, don't go right (there is a military base), follow the hotel indications, at the hotel (on left) take the way on the right and you will be here in 700 meters. You could identify the spot by the wood bridge and the white painted stones. Enjoy it!

name: Passport checkpoint
description: To go to Petroglyphs there is a checkpoint here. At the gate of the childtens camp they only want to see your passport and let you through, so just follow the road. This is not a military zone as previously mentioned.

name: Very big historical cemetery
description: Like a village, this cemetery is very big, on several little hills. On gps coordenates are the most historical values, differents types of mausoleums in very good conditions. Acces by second door of cemetery (coming from Turkmenistan), park out. At first door you can enter inside and park close to he gardian house, it's very interesting to walk between the traditional uzbek tombs and old mausoleums. The old gardian calls Mush, he proposed us to visit the historical zone, he guided us free, just we give him any thing to eat, but you can do it alone.

name: Bek hotel
description: I stayed in double room for 70000sum included breakfast and registration very clean. I’m not sure about this price is for off-season or not

name: Takhtakaracha
description: Just after pass there’s road to left unpaved, keep going and you will see the abandoned rusty cabin, go through the gate on the right there are lot of awesome camping spots. But there’s no water supply so fill up the bottle at the spring before the pass.

name: Currency exchange money
description: The only one in this area. Go inside second coutiyard and on your right. No english talk.

name: Tourist office
description: Very kind staff. They will listen and help you, just ask. They can send postcards. From may or june 2018 normally they will can make you the registration certified (and no need pay hotel).

name: Lovely border valley, forbiden to camp
description: It's a very nice alpine valley, river, horses, 4000m mountains, forest,.... There is a piste (no very good conditions but possible with hihg 2wd). Only one problem: it's a militar border zone and you don't can rest to camp here...

name: Spring water
description:
Close the road. There is a fountain from spring water. There are any little shops. 

This water source give water direct from mountain. It's a built source, the water exit by a lion mouth... there are 3-4 sale post (it's in a mountain road) around the source, a lot of Uzbeks were around the sale posts... Normally, the water is save to drink and me and my wife didn,t have problems after drink it.

name: Militar control
description: We said we're tourist, they asked us for our way. Easy.

name: Green flat spot close the river
description: A very good stop in the way to or from the Zaamin National Park. It's between diferents farms and there are people in the way in the day but nobody at night, you can see their rural life. Some local comed to talk us but very kind and short. You're close a little river and on a very green space. At night we had a very nice sky. It's in the road to Myk fortress and Chortangi Canyon (we didn't visit it). 2/3 big rigs possible.

name: In the midst of fields
description: Differents spots in farmland. You can take the dirt way at 39.701456, 68.090988 and find your spot. Also you could find others flat spots in the area. It's a very extensive flat valley surrounded by high mountains. The main road is not in good conditions but you will have a amazing and lovely scenery.

name: 2nd biggest bazar of Uzbekistan
description: Only in weekend, here there is the second most big market of Uzbekistan. There are no tourist souvenirs shops. It's worth to visit for the local ambience, for the prices (the first price they say you are very low in comparation at tourist zones shops) and for the magnitude (it's like a quarter). You can come here by your own car or by gipsy taxi from Samarkand (at 39.652281, 66.970156) for 5000 /6000 som (don't take a yellow taxi). Just enjoy it and make good shopping (don't forget to say "baraka" when you have the last agree price!).

name: Nice Viewpoint
description: Very nice viewpoint ton the reservoir and N.P. high mountains. It looks possible to go and camp at south lakeside (there is a dirt way).

name: DIESEL
description: Here they have an diesel pump. The cheaper diesel that we had in Uzbekistan, 5000som in april 2018.

name: 1st car documents control
description: There is a stop barrier. The documents of the vehicle must be taken to the control office that is right after barrier on the right. They register and they open the barrier.

name: Uzbek border
description: We cross from Uzb. to Kazak. Passengers must lower the first door, their passage is very easy. At the coordinates there is the vehicle control. When we passed, we waited for someone who spoke English and they told us everything. The country's entry documents must be delivered with the photocopy of the passport of the driver and the vehicle (in another office they give you photocopies) but they did not ask for any hotel registration card. The passport, documents of the vehicle and the van controls were very short. Easy and friendly. There are toilets (but a bit dirty...).

name: Nice camping close to former Aral Lake
description:
If you would have been here 50years earlier it could have been good for swimming. ;-) 
Today it is just a nice flat area with some gras. There is a view on the former lake and its little sheltered from wind because its not all the way ob top of the mountain.

name: Nice view on the bay of Aral Lake
description: Nice flat area with nice view on the bay of Aral Lake. Several more places like this along the way. Very remote. No people anywhere.

name: Road down from plateau
description: At this point a road is leading down from the plateau towards the Aral Lake.

name: Hicking path down to Lake
description: At this place you can find a possibility to get down to the lake. The path is very steep! but it is possible to get down if you  have some hicking knowledge. There are several options and no path can be seen. You can get down at the gap in the cliff to the left or all the way in front down at the rock tower. Always stay little left. To the right you end up at a vertical cliff. If you down it is another 2km (in April2018)  to the water. Have fun!

name: Diesel and Petrol - 80 & 91
description: Diesel and petrol available here. 80 and 91

name: Field with sheeps and river
description:
nice and quiet place between two small creeks. many sheep and cowherds around but the street is 2 km away.
easy for 2wd.

name: Fortress Toprak Kala
description: Guard at checkpoint asked for 4000Som fee (with paper ticket).

name: Next to Amu-Darya river
description: At this area you can find several spots for staying the night along the river. There are also some trees if you need shade. Locals come here for fishing and picknick.

name: Filtered water from tap
description:
Here at this place you can refill your tank with filtered water. Many locals come here. Right at the corner. See small sign at fence. 

Price August 2019 100 Som per litre.

name: Avtoservice
description: Good mechanic, improvises creatively if necessary, repaired our shock absorber changed the radiator and thermostat of our Landrover Defender and repaired the broken frame of our foldable caravan (Rapido Confort). You only have to negotiate the price. In the first moment it seems to be expensive, but in the end the price is fair.

name: Wild Camping near Pakhtakar (between Samarkand and Tashkent)
description: 1,5 km away from the main road on a meadow between a small channel and a creek. Quiet place, only some shepards are passing with their sheep and cows. There's a lot of space for more than one vehicle.

name: Parking near Siob Bazar
description: Big parking below Siob Bazar, but seems to be to far away for locals, parking was not crowded. Were alone on parking during the night. The tramway is turning on the parking, which creates some noise. Quiet in the night.

name: Diesel and Petrol (80 and 91)
description:
Diesel price was 5000 Som today. 
Has 80 and 91 octane benzine. Good service, no English. Prices: 80 was 3800, 91 was 4400 SUM

name: Close to "between the meadows"
description: We tried to find the described place "between the meadows" but because of the fields it was impossible to reach the given coordinates. So we placed us just at the side of the path, quite close to the little stream. We had two quite nights here, although in the second night came at 2:30 a car, stopped beside but left after a while... We were invited from a farmers family for dinner and they also offered us to stay at their farm. Really great people!

name: Car bazaar and several workshops
description: In this area of town you find the bazaar for carparts, the street with tire shops and several workshops for all your carproblems.

name: Jeep to fire crater
description: As we are not 4x4, we negotiated here a jeep and driver to the fire crater. We also overnighted here.

name: Border Dashoguz - Turkmenistan Uzbekistan
description: Border . Notting to pay to exit Turkmenistan.

name: Diesel+95
description: First they had no Diesel, but a customer who understood English helped translating. Then they suddenly had Diesel. 4700 Som per Liter.

name: Wild Camp Off the Road
description: On the way from Buxoro to Samarkand there is almost no place without people or houses. This one is a small paradise underneath trees and besides a watering kanal. People greeted friendly but were distant. The entry to this place is from Buxoro-Samarkand 100 m behind the actual spot. Trees are very low, our 3,4m camper hat some problems. For small cars only the sand way may cause difficulties. Close by the road, so a bit noisy. People start to work around the place at 5:30. Get up early!

name: Several sim card dealers
description:
Different telecom shops in this area.
UMS accepted for us.
We managed to get a sim card with 5GB for 42.000 soms (1 month ) at UMS.
You need your passport and a registration receipt.

name: Down by the river
description: A big area between a highway and a river, filled with washed and polished stones. Also some small ponds were formed during the time. (Be careful, there live some snakes). Not the most quiet place, but okay during the night. Close to the city with still a good internet connection with Ucell and Beeline.

name: In the fields
description: Somewhere next the to city, in the middle of green fields, a lot of trees and many water. you can park at two short dead ends. Some cars will pass by and a lot of cows, but everybody was very friendly and helpful.

name: Diesel
description: Hard to find Diesel in Samarkand. Here Diesel for 5100 Sum/litre available. Very nice staff.

name: Supermarket
description: well stocked, big supermarket with reasonable prices

name: Money Exchange
description:
Exchange at Khorezm Palas Hotel. EUR / USD, good rates, very friendly.
(05/2018: 1 EUR = 9500 UZS)

name: Cafe
description: Large cafe at the Uzbekistan side of the border. Hot food and lots of water. Sit around long enough and someone will come and offer to change your dollars to local currency at not-terrible rates (better rates than you'll get given outside on the road)

name: mini market
description: Small market. Nothing special and very limited but it's better than nothing.

name: Small roadside restaurant
description: Long low building with restaurant inside. a bit of a market too. some car oil. trucks parked outside. food is fine. menu is in Uzbek

name: Topchan Hostel
description:
Super cool and well organized Hostel. They have rooms, dorm or you can sleep in your car in front of the hostel.
Rooms are around 25 Dollar. Dorm is 10 Dollar. If you stay in your car its 8 Dollar per person.
Internet is fast. Toilets and showers are very clean. Its a real hostel with english speaking stuff, informafion desk, huge washing machine for 2 Dollar and a good breakfast.

name: Fors.uz
description: Large selection of Motul and Yacco car and moto oils. Other fluids as well.

name: Mountain valley Gulkam river
description:
Slept here two nights. Walked to the waterfall. Beautiful scenery! 500m before the spot passport check/registration but they didn’t write anything down, so we payed nothing. 

Big rigs: can definitely go here but unsure if spot is big enough. Maybe you have to cross the river and go upstream where the Valley widens. 

Tents: further up there are a few grassy pitches.

name: Petrol/Benzin @ Jipek Joli
description: I asked the receptionist whether he knows somebody selling petrol. He made a phone call and 10min later a guy showed up with 5l plastic bottles of Benzin. I payed 5500 som/l. I bought 20 Liters. He said it was 91 octane. Looked “clean” to me. Did use a “mr. funnel” filter though. No issues.

name: Sim card UZmobile
description:
You can by sim card in this shop only ( main shop) when you are tourist.
Sim card+1,5GB+ 600min+600sms=34000 som for one month. 
Need passeport and registration!

name: Oybek/Buston border
description:
Exit Uz: Nothing special, didn’t look into the van. He asked me for the hotel registrations, I gave him four notes (we camped the other nights) he looked at the uppermost and gave them back to me. 

Entry Tj: Easy with E-Visa. They asked 24$ for desinfection, I said no three times and that we didn’t have any cash. They were happy with that answer and wished us a happy journey. During the vehicle registration later we had the chance to tell them that we wanted to stay longer than 15 days (which is the standard temp import time), he looked at the E-Visa and gave us until its expiration date, just ask for it! And of course 25$ road tax which seems to be legit, you get a receipt for that!

On both sides nice guards but a little slow as usual 😉

name: Gold Star Hotel
description: crossed the Border "accidentially" very late and it was to dark to drive to Bukhara (street condition not the best and crazy drivers). we just asked at the reception if we could stay on the parking in front of the Hotel. 10 USD for two persons (first they wanted to have 20) . could use the toilet of an empty room. shower also available but we didn't use it. WiFi quite good. road very close but quit at night. room for two person 40 USD. they can make the Registration for you.

name: Wild Camping @747m in the Uzbek Pamir-Alay
description: Riding the road on the south shore of lake Aydarkul from Nurata to Jizzakh turn right/south ~30km after you passed Temirkovuk. Go up the gravel road towards Guzbin. Go up until the road stops. There is a tiny little stream next to which you can set up camp. I was on a enduro motorcycle. 4x4 probably required. Anything bigger than a Landrover probably a problem.

name: National Bank of Uzbekistan
description:
they change money at the best rate we got till today (for 100 €)
National Bank : 9170
Bank in Khiva : 9100
Kreditbank : 8700
Black market Nukus : 8500

name: Alisher Mechanic
description: After changing tracking rods at Anars place, we had to drive here to get the wheel alignment done. Worked really well!

name: Big supermarket
description: Korzinka supermarket. All you need. Oats, cornflakes, cheese, fruit and veggies. Alas, no ground coffee :/

name: shade
description: Here is a big place with shade. For people who travel in the hot summer :). We took a lunch break here. I think you can also put your tent here.

name: Otabek & Kumush
description:
Great food, very cheap.
Sounds quiet but if it’s someone’s birthday they go mad with loud music and get you up to dance. Great atmosphere but difficult to chat when the music starts.

name: Road to Qisilkum Nature Reserve
description: from the road between Khiva and Bukhara take the asfalted road to Qizilravot. There are plenty of tracks leading to nice spots. Do not take the road till the end, there is a military camp you cannot pass , so you can never reach the nature reserve :-(

name: Diesel and petrol
description: diesel and petrol , 5000 som per liter for diesel, did not try to bargain

name: Qosha Darvoza
description: Small, beautifull hotel in historic building on walking distance of the North Gate. You can park in front on public parking. Double room with airco and private bathroom was 30$ per night breakfast included. Staff speaks English and French.

name: On shore of the lake
description: when arriving at the lake cooling from Nurata don't following road around the lake but small road down to the lake. This becomes a solid track, continue till the track bends, following to the right over the dune.

name: Lazurnaya beach/hotel
description:
Nice stay on or two days.
We pay 50’000 per person for a double bed.
And 6’500 for parking motorbike.
Sasha, the security guy is friendly. 
The beach is nice. The restaurant is not very good. I recomend to go to the bar or there is a resorant near the road before enter in the park.
You can take a bath of natural hot water for free

name: Mihunur hostel
description: Very nice place,  clean room. Very welcoming people. Offered us a delicious dinner right after we entered. Typical Uzbekistan food. $15 per person or $5 if you are okay with a shared Room (5 people)

name: Sim card Beeline
description: Here you can buy a simcard. They will help you install the simcard and they speak a little bit of English. We paid around €13,- for 8,5Gb but ofcourse you can choose less Gb’s.

name: New station
description: Newly built gas station, usually has 91, always 80. Good service.

name: Uzbek / Kazak Border crossing
description: No trucks, only cars, motorbikes, bikes and foot passengers.

name: big supermarket
description:
big supermarket

[.................... failure to meet character requirements ....................]

name: MasterCard/Maestro ATM in Temirs restaurant
description: ATM that accepts MasterCard. Out of money at the moment.

name: May & Sharob Liquor store
description: Here you can buy any kind of beer, vodka, ...

name: Gulnara guesthouse
description: This hostel/hotel is great! Secure parking for motorbikes / SUV/ Vans. The owner is super friendly, speaks perfect English, the breakfast is great place is not expensive, good WiFi. Location is amazing right near the biggest market

name: National bank of Uzbekistan (NBU)
description:
National bank of Uzbekistan. Cash exchange and USD ATM with VISA Card.
 Has ok rates (€1 = 9060 som on 25 June 2018.

Update: Orient Finans Bank down the road also changes back your original currency (keep the certificates!) and cash withdrawal from Maestro and Mastercard in USD and UZS

name: Car bazaar
description: Big car bazaar with generic oil, grease, bearings, cables and tools. Parts mostly for local car brands like Daewoo, Chevrolet, Lada and trucks

name: Orient Finans Bank
description: Good bank that let me change UZS back to EUR. Be sure to keep the cerificates! They also do cash withdrawal for Maestro (my European debit card) and Mastercard in UZS and USD (NOT possible anymore!).

name: Diesel Uzbekneftegaz station
description:
EDIT: last 3 people have reported no diesel. 

Diesel was available here for 4600 Som. In a village further west, we asked for diesel and they tried to sell us black market stuff, explaining that in this region there is no official diesel available. As we had enough spare, we drove on and found this diesel station. So apparently, there is official diesel - even for a good price.

name: BeeLine Store
description: You can purchase your BeeLine SimCard here. We got 2GB for 47000 Som, which is a good price compared to competitor UCell. However, BeeLine only works well in big cities. If you are out in the country, most of the time you will either only have 2G or no reception at all.

name: UCell Store
description: You can get your UCell SimCard here. You need to show your passport. UCell is a bit pricy (15 USD for 2GB), but it has better coverage when you are outside the big cities than its competitors.

name: Car mechanic and welding
description:
I went here after instructions, to get my window fixed again (it wanted to leave my car, they put it back into position)
Friendly guys, no english at all. Looks like a shop where they do basic bodywork and windows. Maybe not for mechanical stuff. You can always ask tourist police together with taxi guys in Khiva

name: Lake Campspot
description: A small track goes from the road down to the lake. Well known by locals. In the afternoon and evening some family’s come here for swimming or fishing. But quiet at night. The water level rised 30cm during the two days we stayed here. Beautiful landscape!!

name: Suspension workhop
description: Specialist for suspensions, fixed my problem, very friendly but no english

name: Fol'kvagen
description: The engineer service of this garage fixed our cooling and ventilation system of our VW T4. They didn't had the parts the first day but we could come back the next day and they had new fans for us. They also replaced the thermostat to better suit hot climates. Very good service!

name: Ikat House
description: Lovely, peaceful hotel in small, friendly village. $30 for a double room

name: Taomhoma
description: Good local restaurant set over a river. Shashlik (of course), soups, etc

name: petrol station
description: Petrol Station. Recently build. July 2018  Not much else to find around here.

name: Evo + internet center
description:
The fastest point for internet. We used it to send some photos and videos. 
Open from 9 to 23 
One hour : 6000 som

name: Diesel black market
description:
Got diesel here. At one of the gates some guys were sitting. Paid 6000 Som per litre
German guy also used this for his Ford Tdci without issues

name: Home stay
description: The (only) motel in the city is not for international tourists, but they arranged this home stay. Very large room, good airco, bathroom and a tv. 2 beds but could easily fit more people I guess. We paid 15 USD per person. No breakfast or wifi

name: AsakaBank
description: Cash withdrawal of USD with Maestro/MasterCard and exchange to UZS

name: ATM
description: There was a working ATM inside in July 2018

name: Laliopa hostel
description: Nice hostel with Nice staff, good room and the cheapest hostel in town. We payed $22 with 2 persons and a Child. For a prived room with a/c, bathroom and breakfast. Carparking in frond of hostel. Also Nice for kids!

name: Bank excata
description: Very easy to change money here, no passport needed. Good english and friendly staff. Got the official rate (9.40 somoni to 1 USD). Closed for half an hour during lunch. ATM outside advertises with Maestro/MasterCard/Visa but my maestro transaction did not work.

name: Flat spot overlooking the river in a bend
description: Pretty epic view, small flat area just a few meters from the ravine. Max 3 tents, no cars. Slightly exposed though.

name: Buchka Pub and Restaurant
description:
awsome pub with food! very nice atmosphere, with outside sitting and inside with a/c
great draft beer (that is made at the factory behind the pub), meat, french fries and salads. they also have veggy shishliks!
really cool place, in a street full of more pubs....

name: Family and Friends Hostel
description:
Opened up 2 months ago. Shared bathroom, but very clean and new for 10USD per person in a single room. They are located in a back alley. At the moment no safe parking, but safe area to leave the bike outside on the streets.
Hostel manager said he plans to provide safe parking in the future.
Rooms are located on third floor.

name: cheep hostel
description:
OK place, nothing special, but cheap. o
One night 
 costs 50.000 som per person, shower 5.000 som, hot meal 15.000, wifi available

Edit: paid 7 USD negotiated from 15 USD. got an exchange rate of 8,400 som per dollar

name: benzin and disel station
description: diesel cost 5700 som / liter. pump did not stop when full

name: Payraviy Guesthouse
description:
it's located on street m. payraviy 38
People there are so nice, they speak English. 

Accommodation +registration +breakfast and wifi 10$ per person

name: restaurant ошхона
description: great place! main course 10.000 for dish, you have to ask about "kompot"! it's great! we paid 60.000 for dinner for 4 person with tea

name: south gate
description: gate to kiva center. we drove in. nothing to pay.

name: river spot
description: Flat spot at the river, close to the road but quiet at night. Some locals came for a swim. Restaurant near by.

name: propane
description:
They have real propane!!
not methane!
It's difficult to find here in Uzbekistan, 
as mostly they have methane. (which doesnt work well for the fridge and cooking)
They might not have the correct adapters.

name: Registon Plaza
description: inside of Hotel there are ATM Maschines to get money. you can get Dollar and Sum.

name: Shaded parking with city view
description: free parking near by registon, restaurants and shop 250 m

name: citywall
description: Free parking in front of city wall, possible for a night.  Many locals around but after 23h it was quiet.

name: Tir park
description: It's a big tir park (industrial zone). for 10manat you can find everything. there are some garages and restaurants... you can also sleep here, but its very busy

name: military checkpoint
description: Passport and car control on the way out of Turkmenistan.

name: Truck stop and restaurant
description: Good restaurant. We were also allowed to sleep in a small room at the rear. Quite expensive though for a simple room but we had a good nights rest here.

name: Veterinary Clinic
description: We stopped here to get a health certificate for our dog before crossing the border to  Tadjikistan. They provided one with a three days availability and we paid 45 000 sum.

name: DNM Motors
description: Perfect place to fix a few things and change oil before driving the Pamirs. The owner speaks perfectly English and the price is good.

name: Petrol
description: Fuel station. Recently built, has 91oct, 4600/l, nice people.

name: Bustan Turism Lake Akcha
description: Touristic yurtcamp at lakeside. Hotel in construction, finished in 2019. Verry friendly people. They didn't charge us for staying one night, but they appreciate when you order a meal from the restaurant. The meal can be brouhgt to your van. We didn't use electricity, but I think you can get it when you ask for it.

name: petrol 91
description: They have 91, but unfortunately no Diesel.

name: Old station with diesel
description: Diesel was available here today. Pumps and station is old but the diesel looked OK.

name: Gas station with 91 petrol
description: One of very few official gas stations with real petrol (80 and 91 benzin for 4500 som)

name: Bugun Sotuvda
description: Diesel available from bottles in station for 6000 SOM a litre in a bottle. 7000 SOM a litre from the pump.

name: Original Farovon Diyor MCHJ
description: Diesel  5500 SOM a litre from a pump.

name: Diesel
description: 5,800 SOM p/l, expensive but we were struggling to find it .

name: Milliy Mehmonxona Guesthouse/Hostel
description:
Nice traditional Guesthouse in one of the old buildings. It has a rest area to sit, shared toilets (where you have to stand), hot water shower and rooms with traditional beds (the blankets), and TV. We paid 7$ per Person, without breakfast. Chai  You with cookies you get for 5000. Internet is not really fast. Motorbikes can park inside, cars not.
Nice place to stay.

name: Otabek B&B
description: Very friendly host family. Clean and comfortable rooms with en-suite bathrooms for 25$ per night for a double room including breakfast. You can park right in front of the house but you'll need pass narrow streets to get there (no problem with a Landrover Defender but probably with a truck).

name: sharof-bobo
description: Local restaurant with very good plov and lagman. Around 20000som/pers.

name: Asia Khiva Hotel - working ATMs
description: Came here to Hotel Adia as the ATM in Arkanchi Hotel for ViSA did not work. Could retrieve dollars.

name: Hotel Asia Parking
description:
You can park on the secured parking of Hotel Asia and sleep in your van. It is really well located and you get access to toilet and shower in building next to parking lot. They do registration+ you can use their fast wifi in the comfortable lobby.
10$ per day for parking.
They are helpful and also agreed to be posted here on ioverlander. ATM in lobby.

name: Korean Restaurant
description: Very good Korean restaurant. Friendly staff and correct prices.

name: Hafsi Kabir
description: Great place! clean& new A/C rooms with private bathroom, decent wifi, Roof terrace and nice breakfast included. $30 for a double. They have space to lock in your moto next door. Owners are really nice.

name: Border crossing
description: For vehicles, you must pass the border in Osh, this border is only for pedestrians and cyclists!

name: Tashkent International Clinic
description:
World Nomads Insurance gave us the details for this clinic when we needed a medical issue investigated.
All speak English and full services on site.
If you use google maps or maps.me it’s the big security doors you need to go to.
No signs outside and looks like a military establishment 
Excellent care and assistance also dealt direct with our World Nomads Insurance

name: Jeyran Hotel
description: Simple Hotel ran by extremely nice family. $17 USD for private room with shower and nice breakfast

name: Gross Sug’urta
description:
Car insurance.
Park here and on opposite side of the road. Go up the stairs to the right of the trustbank.

I was charged 30000 som (£3.00) for 2 months for my Land Rover.

Some english spoken. One girl is a fluent english teacher .

name: Moto Service - Avoid
description: I would not recommend this place. I had some bent forks and a seal that needed replacing on my motorcycle. He told me it would take a day or two. It's been 5 days and the motorcycle looks the same as the day I brought her in. Don't do it.

name: Bushes and a hole
description: Better than most of the surrounding desert for camping because you can hide from the road.

name: Great and quiet.
description: Nice bivouac for cyclists with grass and bushes to be well hidden. One of the few quiet places along the route from Samarqand to Bukhara.

name: Hostel Muynak
description: Expensive and not very good, but it's the only place in town that does registrations.

name: Black market diesel
description: We were taken here by somebody who knew somebody who knew somebody who had diesel. It was poor quality and we paid 7000 som/litre. But, maybe you're desperate.

name: Hotel Muynak
description:
Friendly staff, truly terrible hotel. With a bit of haggling, we paid $15/night for a double, which is cheaper than the hostel and yurts if you're 2 people.

We couldn't find any open guest houses, so this is probably the only place in town where you can get a private room.

name: Yodgorlik Silk Factory
description: English-speaking guides will show the impressive traditional production of silk. No pre-booking necessary, just show up. If you buy something in the shop the tour is for free.

name: Hélène Oasis
description:
The landlady is French and has restored this beautiful house in the traditional ouzbek style. 40 rooms with private bathroom and toilets and air conditioning
Breakfast is perfect and there are backyards to rest.
Very well located in the city center of boukhara.
Starting price 50 euros for a double bed room including breakfast.

name: Diesel
description:
Diesel at 6300UZS, not negotiated.
Quality looks Ok.

name: Diesel Station
description:
We found Diesel at this station since the one mentioned on IOverlander 500m away did not have Diesel.
We paid 5500 cyms/liter

name: On the reservoir
description:
The lake was not full so it created huge banks where only few fishermen and shepherds go with their cars or sheeps.
Coming from south, take the road on the right just before the dam. If you take one of the small access slope before the road becomes private, you will find an almost flat green area where you can easily park.
No-one came bothering us, it was very peaceful. There is no shade but the weather was cloudy and it was enough to feel good.

name: Jules Verne
description:
Very nice and newly built hostel. The morning breakfast is very good too. WiFi is good if you are close to the rooter which is located at the reception. The washing machine was free of charge if you're doing everything by yourself.

We asked to sleep in our van and they accepted. There is an alley for 2 vans in their private house just next to the hostel. We negotiated 5$/night for 2 people, breakfast included. I think their portal is 2m30 high. If you're higher, you can park on the street.
They even washed our car because it was Saturday (car wash day according to them).

name: Tyre shop
description: Tyre shop for all vehicles, reasonable prices

name: Embassy of Turkmenistan
description:
Embassy of Turkmenistan
Opens at 9.00. We were here on a Friday.
For Visa issues, enter at the back of the embassy.
You may park at the parking in the front.
Security guard present.

name: Welder / Car Repair
description: If you need a welder for small repairs, that’s the right place .

name: Fuel station Diesel / Gasoline
description:
april ‘19: no diesel
sept ‘18: Petrol station near Kukand, petrol and Diesel available

name: Mekhtar guest house
description:
cozy hostel in Bukhara just few minutes walk from the center.
room comfortable and nice common area.
there's room to park motorcycles or bicycles, cars can be park outside but is still a safe road and neighborhood.
The manager is an A*****. And makes his employees pay if he makes mistakes.

name: Quite place at small river
description: Beautiful spot right at a small river. You can swim in the water and there is lots of wood for a camp fire. Some cows are passing by and you might spot some rare birds like we did. (Pelicans, cranes)

name: USD withdrawal with 1.5% fee
description: Inside restaurant Platan I was able to withdraw USD and Soms both with 1.5% commission, VISA only.

name: Local Golden Fish restaurant
description:
fresh tasty fish and other food, a look of truck drivers stops here.
if you hungry  stop here, fish was good

name: Orient Bank cash withdrawall
description: You can get dollars with your VISA or Mastercard. It works like a payment in a shop. They take you 1 dollar fee without telling you.

name: at an uncompleted dam/ rivercamping
description: gravel or grass patches to both sides of the bridge. Middle of town. friendly locals / fishermen. small shops nearby.

name: Petrol and Diesel
description: Fuel station with petrol and diesel. We paid 5500 som for diesel.

name: Visa ATM in the hotel
description: There's an ATM for VISA cards inside the hotel hall. I withdrew 200$ and was charged 203$ without the booth telling you beforehand.

name: Benzine 95 available
description: There's benzine 95 available here. 4300 sum

name: mechanics for wheels and axles
description:
A local Uzbek accompanied me here. It's a group of workshops dealing with everything about wheels, tires, direction, etc. Quite friendly and professionals. They had the machine for accurate alignment for my car. Although they did not know my car wheels system, they quickly figured out how to fix the problems.
You have to enter a gate and the workshops are inside in a wide patio

name: UMS SIM card
description:
UMS network
5Go tourist plan for 42'000 Sum
2Go tourist plan for 21'000 Sum
They speak some english, 15 minutes registration. You don't need hotel registration. You need your passport.
—>Update June 2019 below!

name: Friendly truck stop
description:
First truck stop restaurant you come to on the right (driving east), though there are others we didn’t try.

Family owned restaurant (friendly but no English). Came out to save us in deep sand from close by spot. Not sure if there’s a menu, but the best Laghman in Uzbekistan! They are happy with camping in the car park and offered sleep inside with other truckers by the stove - good option for winter. Outdoor long drop toilet by parking.

name: Tyre shop and garge
description:
Helpful place through no English speaking in the garage itself. 

What makes it stand out is that the corner shop owner next door is a old English teacher and opposite are students studying English. Best place in town if you need a good translation for any complicated car problems. 
Can’t vouch for garage as we only got tyre fixed, but friendly and cheap. 

Leave plenty of time, you will undoubtedly meet the extended family, all who want to practice their English.

name: Camping with a view
description:
free camping/parking with view of the Registan.
walking distance to the bazaar.

name: Quick paspoort check
description: Quick passport control, the last one at the border to Uzbekistan.

name: Roadside restaurant
description: There ain't much along this stretch of the road, but here the 'locals' seem to stop for lunch... Good falov, big portions, look for the builiding with the covert terras in front

name: black market diesel
description:
We had very little diesel. In the truck garage we bought 10L
1L per 5500som.  I think it is not bad oil. maybe you can use this site for emergencies.

name: Bushland camp- no shade- quiet
description: Lots of space to camp, big rigs fit, tents and vans/off-roaders can't be seen from the road. No shade at all. Flat. No one around, some smaller fields though, so in the summer there might be people.

name: Elegant Hotel
description:
Basic but nice small hotel with very friendly owners.
Rooms from $22. We paid $30 for a double room with private shower and breakfast included.
Small courtyard. Street parking only, but it is a very quiet residential street and is covered by cctv and a 24 hour presence.
Big rigs will struggle but our Land Rover Defender fitted fine.

name: OVIR office
description: We had some questions regarding our visa and possible extension. Extending an e-visa was not possible unfortunately.

name: Cake Laboratory
description: Small cake & coffee shop, they also have sandwiches and soup. They sell all sorts of delicious cakes, really tasty after the Fann mountains and Pamir 🤤

name: Gosht restaurant
description: Very good restaurant, as a vegetarian literally the best food I’ve had in six months. Fresh and original salads, vegan burger, good fresh lemonades. (Meat dishes also very good.) Get the fig-beetroot-cheese-truffle-salad!!

name: Potter Mania
description: For everybody who likes Harry Potter. The restaurant and menu is adapted like hogwarts castle...with the goblet of fire and much more,enjoy!

name: Gross Sug’arta car insurance.
description: Car insurance, small building on the main road. Quick and easy, took us 5 mins. Bring your pasport, licence and car documents. We paid 3 dollars for 1 month & 2 drivers for our Land Rover. One year is 10 dollars.

name: Chibantay wildcamp
description: We found it hard to spot a good campground on our way to Samarkand. But we found a nice field for camping around Chibantay. It’s 500m outside the village on a big grassy field. No shade and you’re in sight. But quiet and no one bothered us. You’ll still hear the trains and main highway, although they’re km’s away.

name: Diesel from pump
description: Diesel available, price was 5500, we didn’t negotiate so maybe you can get it down. Was the first station we tried so easy to find diesel here. Also advertised petrol.

name: Iran embassy
description: At 20 Parkent St, ask the guard for the entrance door, opens at 9am.

name: Bivouac at the lake
description:
Nice and quiet place at the lake. Sandy road leads to the point. 2WD possible. But road to sandy road bmpy already. Only some fisherman came by to say hi and drink some tea with us. 
No shade.

name: Magistr café
description: Good café/coffee place, serves nice breakfast, coffee, pizza and all sorts of dishes. It’s cheap and had wifi as well.

name: Trip.LE hostel
description: Large hostel, newly opened. Very friendly young owners. Everybody speaks English. We were the first big rig/sleeping in the car guests. They were very accommodating and we end up paying half price of the dorm. Best breakfast we have seen while traveling the Stan’s included.

name: Trip.Le
description:
50 bed hostel, room for two big rigs, one on drive, one on street, one small rig in garden. Excellent location. Ver
y good price for private rooms, dormitory, park &  sleep in truck. Breakfast is Very good. Place is always busy, good open area and large kitchen to meet and talk to other travelers. English speaking, fun, helpful owners. I

name: spring water
description: good flow. used by local as drinkable water

name: Kangly wildcamp in the hills.
description: Wonderful quiet hills covered with farmland. Some fields are not used and are a perfect campsite. At night you can see the entire valley and stars. In the morning a shepherd and farmer came over to say hello. No water around unfortunately and no shade or cover.

name: Wild camp at aiderkul lake
description:
Beautiful area! Follow the road on maps.me, about 20k from the main road. There are numerous tracks towards the water. Some mosquitos when there’s no wind. Couple local hunters and fishermen came by to say hello and share some of their catch. It felt like we were camping on the Dutch Wadden-islands.

Quiet at night. Road is doable for all cars, but towards the main lake it can get sandy. Note the water is saline, not potable, so bring enough.

name: diesel station
description: Quite old but have diesel. 7000 som Nov 19.

name: Kir Kiz Qala
description: We were suprised how big it was, the walls were probably over 1,5km long. The remains of the wall are very scenic. You can drive inside the fort and camp there if you want. Access is from a dirt road between the fort and asphalt road. No shade, but cover from the wind.

name: Kyzyl Qala fortress
description: Only fortress that’s partially restored with original mudbricks. If you do a tour i would do this one last, to see how the other fortresses would’ve looked like. There is a checkpoint, but no guard around in November.

name: Black market diesel
description: No diesel available in Khiva or Urgench. So with a local from our hotel we went here. Diesel 5000 sym and winterdiesel 6500 sym. Its a old house and they sell from big plastic jerrycans.

name: convinience store and water
description: convinience store and water pump just along the road

name: Art house hotel
description: Nice place, amazing breakfast, parking in front. Enter from north gate. They helped us get diesel! $30 usd per night for room with bathroom

name: Savitsky museum - Nukus
description:
Two buildings, the archive is now also located on the square. 
One building is 55.000 per person, visiting two buildings is 80.000 (march 2020), one buildings is roughly 1-1,5 hour. Closed on Mondays.

Nice collection, but if you’re not an art enthousiast, the detour from Khiva just for the museum would probably be just a bit too much.

(Read comments for a different opinion) :-)

name: rishton ceramica museum
description: Ceramica musea/ traditional family workshop where you can have a look inside the traditional ways of rishton ceramic

name: Diesel and propane
description: Diesel and propane station. We payed 6000 sums per liter.

name: sim card
description: you can buy Beeline, Ucell and UMS sim cards.

name: water pipe
description: not easy to find. under the bridge level on the side (look at the photo enclosed) local use it but not sure if you can drink it. correct flow. muddy when raining.

name: Autoservis diesel expert
description:
Very good and friendly garage. Quite old buildings but they can do pretty much everything. We have a Citroën Jumper and they had to unmount all our motor to order spare parts from Turkey (4 days to arrive) and change :
- Glow plug
- Valve kit
- Cam kit
- Valve seal
- Cylinder head gasket
- Cylinder head repairs
- Injektor repairs
For a reasonnable price compare to the work they have done.

name: Diesel from Turkey (Black market)
description:
5500uzs for 1 liter of very good quality diesel from Turkey.
This place was shown to us by a friend whose living in Samarqand. They could even fill up our extra tank. Nobody speak english.

name: Diesel
description: 8000uzs per liter of very good quality diesel. Recommended by a local garage. Unfortunately they are not allowed to fill your extra tank (Update November 2019: They filled my secondary tank but not the jerrycans). They can take visa and master card too.

name: Beeline
description:
English speaking. With the "Welcome" offer, you can have :
- 3Gb + 500 Mb of internet
- 1Gb WhatsApp, Telegram, Viber
- 100 minutes
for 36000uzs (1 month)

name: Visa ATM and change
description:
Inside the Miran international hotel there is an ATM which take visa card to have $ or UZS.
Here is also possible to change money for very good price.

name: EMS post office
description:
Here you can send package/gift to your country.
If you have dry food, you need to make a certificat there which cost 30000uzs.
Our package was around 2kg and the price was approximately 485000uzs

name: Visa ATM Kapitalbank
description: There is a visa ATM where you can have $ or UZS. When it's not working, just go inside to take some dollars then you can change it to UZS for a small fee 1.5%

name: Visa ATM 24/7
description: ATM which is taking visa card. You can have dollars with small fee of 1.5% (NOT POSSIBLE ANYMORE).

name: Quiet place in a small green area
description: We spent 2 very quiet nights there in low season. But we don't known if it's open in summer time.

name: Aralsk 7 abandoned Soviet base and city
description:
Aralsk-7 was the name for a secret island in the middle of the Aral Sea where the Soviets tested biochemical weapons. It’s also called Rebirth Island or Anthrax Island. Now it’s abandoned and accessible because the Aral Sea is almost gone.

We’ve visited quite some abandoned cities, but this was one of the best. There are multiple sights: the labs, the factories, the city - for family of the researchers - and 2 airfields. Lots of buildings, flats, garages and even a football field etc are (semi)-intact and you’ll find multiple tanks and vehicles lying around. The US government cleaned the island in the ‘00’s, so is should be safe. We spend an entire afternoon on the island and met some looters that were looking for metal, so slowly they’re tearing and burning everything apart.

Strangely there’s a good gravel road from Moynaq all the way to the island - we drove 80kmph on average. After
the road ends, follow the dirt road for 15kms. It’s on maps.me: take the west road from Moynaq and not the east road! Be careful, it’s a long way and there is no-one around for miles and miles. Civilization stops after the drilling rigs. Also no water, just endless sand.

name: uzbeck invest insurance
description: vehicle insurance, two weeks 3 us dollars! first floor above bank.

name: Broccoli cafeteria
description:
Very nice cafeteria with traditional drinks and food. If you come after 9pm you will have 20% of discount.
But if you come too early, The Black bar downstairs is a good alternative to wait until 9pm 😋

name: An amazing cold soup
description: Here you can ask for the Kykcn (pronounce it like CookC). It's a very tasty corean speciality for less than 10000uzs. They also have amazing desert.

name: Shovot Border - Uzbekistan/Turkmenistan
description:
Very easy border which is opening at 9am. We spent the night just before it with trucks around us without any problem. It took us 25 minutes to go out of this border.
They did ask for our registration.

name: Former Cheap Hostel with Registration
description: Hostel with russian speaking staff. Nice double rooms with WiFi. They do Registration Slips. 5$ per Person for nice room with Shower.

name: UB Bank Change
description: Bank with official rates. Open 10-18h Mo-Fr

name: B&B coffe house
description: Really nice coffe house. good cakes. medium price.  menu in English. lots of parking. We actually stayed in our big rig overnight here but it's on a min road and very noisy.

name: Behind the dunes
description:
We used this place to stay for the night before visiting Kantubek (former Russian base and laboratory).
300m from the road but hidden behind some dunes. Quiet but no facilities, no cell coverage.

name: Fuel station
description: filled up with diesel today, 90lt at 5500 som per litre cash only.

name: layby Theft
description: parked in the layby overnight somone forced our fuel cap and took about 200L of diesel. take care if staying overnight. maybe use truck stop 5mins down road towards tashkent

name: Quiet Spot for the night
description:
On the way to Samarkand we found a nice spot beside an abandoned building, flat and suitable for big rigs.
LTE is available via Beeline

name: IBSA Hostel
description:
Nice quite new hostel with a reasonable parking lot. We camped with our big rig in front of the hostel and could use the facilities. Very friendly and helpful owner and employees. If you have a big rig definitly better than jules verne as it is directly at a bigger street. Still more or less quiet from 22:00 on.
Water to fill the tank and electricity was offered. They do as well registration.

name: Best Place in Bukhara
description: We went to the other places in the city but this is the best place to park and stay overnight if you want to be in the city. It's a huge parking lot. we were here in March and it's not particularly busy. The police are opposite for good security but are no bother. all the sights are a few mins walk away. easy access for big rigs. small supermarket 10mim walk around the corner. public toilet 3mins away.

name: Near the zoo
description:
We tried to find a spot to park with our big rig for one or two nights in Duschanbe. Hotel Tajikistan was too small...
Here we could park and no one bothered us. Zoo closed at 6pm. It‘s a bit noisy from the street during the evening but ok by night.
There is an artificial lake in 2min walking distance with some amenities and a nice promenade to have a walk.

name: Fortress parking
description: parking right next to the fort. we stayed overnight with no issues. both parking and fort get very busy in the day. best to arrive late (after 3pm) then overnight and enjoy the fort to yourselves first thing.

name: pistachio forest
description: This area is incredibly beautiful. The road sometimes winds along on the top of the ridges of the mountains. The colors of the landscape is mesmerizing. The road leads through pistachio forest/plantations. The oldest trees are around 500 years old. I have seen this area in September and April. In April everything was blooming and green. In September most of the vegetation is brown and dry. Perfect road for people on motorcycles.

name: Diesel and 91 UL petrol station
description: You can get diesel and 91 octane unleaded petrol at this station. Don't be confused by the shabby looks of the place. It is open even though it does not look like it. You probably have to knock at the window a few time because the guard might be asleep. I am not sure, if this place is open during the night. You can only pay in cash.

name: Graf
description:
Do you need registration ? No problem! 5$ per person per night , you can sleep at your vehicle and do the registration at Hostel. Laundry 30000 sum per wash.

Rooms with shared or private bathroom, starting around 12€, breakfast, taxes, registration and a/c included.

Dinner available, fast WiFi, very clean place close to all sights in the old town.

name: Camping between bushes and small trees
description: A quiet spot reachable by 2wd. You are not visible from the road or houses. Road noise, dogs and donkeys are audible but not disturbing. One shepherd came by. No real shade. At 41.682963, 61.089655 turn off the main road onto the sandy track and turn right at the junction. There are multiple other places to stop along the track.

name: Public tap for neighbourhood
description: Simple plastic, white tap. For inhabitants who don’t have running water at home. It was ok for us to use it.

name: Shower for 8000 Sum
description: Where the toilets are there is also the posibility to take a shower (a bit shabby one) for 8000 Sum. Didn’t use it but they said it’s a hot one.

name: Above the Yurts
description: Nice flat space above the yurt camp sheltered from wind by a small hill. Even though it is close to the tourist camp nobody came by in the two nights we stayed there. Be careful with all the rabbit/marmots and sink holes in the ground. They can swallow you whole. Some are up to 4m deep. 4x4 is recommended for the steep access road.

name: Manti Xona
description: Lovely local food and fast. The most obvious five dishes. Kind people. And a lot of frogs singing. Aprox 2 euro per person.

name: National Bank Money Exchange
description:
NBU in Bukhara, usually here you find the best exchange rates.
2019.04: 1$ = 8420 Som

name: Kvinta print
description: Copy shop that will only print official digital letters (this is 2019!) with the word copy on it. Old style “Apparatsky”.

name: Uzbekneftegaz
description: Diesel. 6500 Sum/liter. Open 24x7 ......

name: Diesel and Petrol: Baxt AN
description: Diesel 5700 Sum per liter. The sign said 4800 Sum.

name: Hotel Poykent
description:
This is a hotel for workers, but they have some rooms for tourists. The rooms are big, the place is new and clean. 

We paid 10$ a person, Wifi is ok. There is additional dinner and breakfast, but the menu is not specially for tourists. 

The receptionist speaks good english and we were allowed to park our bicycles in the back.

name: Moynoq
description: They give us 90 liter Diesel for 6000 som per liter

name: Mechanic  A380
description: Very good workshop. The staff is friendly and immediately helps.

name: Yangiobod Bazaar (Non - Food)
description: Huge Bazaar where you can find basically everything (except for food). hardware, tools, spare parts, electronics etc. Also lot of used and vintage stuff. like a huge flea market.

name: Camping behind Dunes
description: Enter via a dirt track from the main road. there is a small garbage dump at the first place but the track leads further where it's better. No 4wd needed but later the track gets a bit narrow. There seem to be sheep/goats around, so watch out for ticks. it's not completely hidden and you can hear the traffic, but as it's difficult to find good wild-camping spots in Fergana valley it's a good spot for one night.

name: Aloqabank Money Exchange
description: Exchange for Dollars, Euro, Swissfrancs, got 8420 Som for 1 Dollar

name: palace oft Themen chan
description: large parking lot in front of the palace of Chan, good for one night, supermarket next to it,

name: diesel
description: got diesel here vor 6000 som per liter, has also petrol

name: Bazar Dekhan museum Babur
description: we park from 4pm and sleep in without any problem. the policemen came around 8pm and said good night😀. very good place in the center for a quick visit of the mosq, place and really Nice market where you will find good food! a good start for us in Uzbekistan.

name: Beeline telecom
description:
you can get your sim card here with a welcome offer for.30000 for one month. check the details with the following picture!
Nice welcome. and you get an explanation in french also

name: parking close to Khan Palace
description:
