Currently this car park is closed but you can enter with your motorhome as the local people says it's okay, so we parked and slept here. Really quiet. free. and two minutes walk from Khan Palace. 
supermarket just behind.

name: Gas station
description: Here, there is diesel. 6000 soum per liter. At first the Guy don’t unserstand and don’t want to refill us. A man translate for us and after it’s ok !

name: VISA ATM
description:
Inside Asia Hotel there is a working Visa ATM delivering US Dollars and Soms.
1.5% fee for Dollars
9% fee for soms
There is a working Visa ATM delivering US Dollars and Soms. 1.5% fee for Dollars 9% fee for soms

name: a very good place to stay in Tashkent
description:
very accessible for big truck, motorhome any big car!
between Minor Mosq and television Tower, in front of the canal, next to the entrance of the park, where works two guards. the park is closed at night.
800m walking distance by crossing to the park to the metro Bodomzor.
toilettes on the parking during the day. very good somsa restaurant. shadow and really quiet at night! we were alone every night
next to this area, when you cross the bridge, you will find everything you need : supermarket, alcohol shop Legion, cheap and good restaurant La Shakar where there is WiFi, icecream...
we stayed 3 nights. no problem. safety place with the guards.

name: Desert Camping
description: The road after the border crossing is very bad. After 4-5 hours driving, we decided to stay here. It's flat, but there's nothing around. pretty much the same all along the way.

name: village
description:
the road from Gazli to Boukhara is dirty so we stopped here for the night. 
it was quiet and people were friendly.

name: water
description: we fill our water tank . it s a car wash,  we gave 5000 soms for it.

name: Water with pipe
description: There is water with a pipe for refill your tank. Some locals drink this water.

name: 24/7 Kapitalbank ATM for USZ&USD
description: Working ATM that is open 24/7 (it is in a little seperate building). It takes VISA and takes a 1.5% commission fee. Dispenses USD (NOT POSSIBLE ANYMORE)  and Uzbek Som.

name: Cemetery
description: Fresh water here, we gave 25000sum for gift

name: Uncle Kolya guesthouse
description:
Traditional family-ran guesthouse in the old city centre, the owners speak a bit of English and are very friendly.

We paid 20$ per night for a huge room with A/C, fast WiFi, breakfast and free use of the washing machine and all facilities (including kitchen). They also have cheaper rooms without A/C as well as dorm rooms.

The shower (shared bathroom) was a bit cold though, not sure if it's always like that but in summer it works out perfectly!

Also they are on Booking.com which makes it super convenient to book on-the-go before arriving!  

Parking is safe but on the streets. Not suitable for big rigs as the streets are narrow... It's probably possible to sleep in the car and use the facilities for a fee but we didn't ask about it.

name: desert camping
description: We camped here, there are flat areas and dunes to hide behind. 4wd recommended as it's soft sand.

name: Guest House Besqala
description:
Very good b&b with breakfast.
Safe place for motobikes inside the yard.
17$ p.p.n. (Summer price)

10,50€/night in 3-bed room winter price.

name: big Makro supermarket
description: we couldn't find any diesel in the valley so we used up our Uzbek Som in this relatively big supermarket.

name: Café Bakery Mone
description: very good Coffee, good sweets, good Restaurant

name: Guesthouse Grand Nur Sultan
description:
Nice guesthouse run by a nice family, newly opened, we could use the shower for 40000 som, rooms are very clean and nice
no parking near, doubleroom is around 40-50$ incl. breakfast, single for 20$
no parking at the hotel, but near parking lot

name: Quiet spot for camping
description: It was quiet and nice. by the river and amongst the fields. a few locals came by and we talked with them but nobody bothered us.

name: garage
description: very very friendly,  no english, but with Google translate on russia it was ok. they change our diesel filter ( we had with us). for our Mercedes 310.

name: Joni & Anton
description:
We had some problems with our Nissan Navara. Joni and Anton are specialized mechanics for motor problems. They ordered spare parts and did a great job.
Delivery of the spare parts punctual 2 days later. 
additional extra: hydraulic ramp and very friendly and helpful

name: Arthur - extremly good welder
description:
Arthur is a master of welding and extremly good. He also does aluminium welding.
We had a serious problem with our car and he fixed it.

name: Asia hotel
description: hotel in Fergana. We stay for one night in the private park for 40 $. We can use the swiming pool, shower, wifi, electricity  ... You have point of water, possibility to throw your black and Grey water. there is a laundry service but it's not included in the price. very nice people who speak english. Registration for 2 person in the price.

name: A nice hidden restaurant
description: Good local food run by women so it's much cleaner and better compared to other places. mantı and kazan kebab were nice

name: Discount Supermarket
description:
Has everything incl. coffee and sugarfree coke, chokolate, veggies, fruits, a butcher ...
but no beer / alcohol

name: Somony statue
description:
Nice view on the city.
just under there is the swimming pool. the entrance fee is 30 somoni pp. no mixte session.
the gazprom station next to the swimming pool can fill your european gaz bottle.

name: fuelstation with diesel
description: got diesel here, 5800 som per liter with receipt, full tank

name: Wild spot at the ruins of Gyaur Kala
description: accessible on a short, decent dirt track from the main road; the occasional tour guide may bring tourists to this spot but they didnt bother us

name: 'ticket both' and gate
description: coming to the fork with the hut that looks like a ticket both (as mentioned by chrisgrainger158), there is a sign and a gate that clearly indicates not to go further … ok the gate was not locked but still .

name: Wild camping overlooking a lake
description:
May 2019: easily accessible and nicely overlooking a lake, you may even drive further down towards the lake; a huge camel herd with 3 'camel boys' on their horses passed by, very friendly

Height restriction of 3.50m when entering from Nukus/Turkmen border. So not really big rig friendly.

name: Dead end almost at the river
description:
The road ends at this point on a little parking which is fine to stay for the night. Easy access to the river, but swimming not really advisable. Popular place among locals but they all disappear in the evening.
The dirt track to the iO spot a couple of hundred meters down the river is basically closed ... but locals still bypass the ditch and drive there (small cars only!)

name: Kalachik salt lake
description:
There is some construction in process to provide facilities, yurts etc., but at this point (May 2019) we could without an issue stay in the shade of the huge cover; friendly locals but no restaurant available
Apparently, one can go for a swim in the lake ...

name: Black Market Diesel
description:
in the most easterly of the TIR parkings …  look out for a tall guy … we negotiated down from 8000 to 6500 (May 2019).
it is top quality, coming straight from the tanks of TKM-trucks ...

name: Long stretches of terrible road
description: May 2019; coming from Bogdon and heading towards Samarkand … not really a pleasure with a big rig … be prepared for 2hrs for 20km …. but there is no alternative

name: Coach parking, convenient for sights
description:
ADMIN NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution. 
May 2019: can be busy during the day as tour buses come and go, but quiet at night (and almost no street lights)
We stayed for 3 nights ... no bother at all
Big rigs should access from the West (Qurbi street) as arriving from the north (Qo'sh Hovuz street) ... is a bit tight ...
BEWARE OF YOUR BELONGINGS AT THIS PLACE!!!

name: wild camping next to the river
description: May 2019: looks like a camping/picknick spot for locals, but apparently not in operation, locals came by but didnt bother or object … hence an ideal, great place to spend a night on the long way to Fergana

name: Diesel
description: we got 30 liters of diesel here, for 5500 som per liter

name: Khiva Azim Ota
description:
Nice Guest House for stay, clean rooms, people friendly speaking english and help full. 20$ per night for a room with air conditioned with breakfast and registration include. Private parking in front of the Guest House. Warm shower.
Possibility Park motorbikes inside garage.

name: diesel station
description:
we found this station for 5800 soums per liter.
the Guy is honest.
we couldn't see the number of liter on the pump but what he did ask at the end was coherent.

name: Bonbon restaurant
description: Very good restaurant, burgers, wraps, pizzas, salads, coffee, and pastry..not expensive. people are friendly, one of them speak english.

name: swimming pool
description: nice swimming pool on Boukhara. for 1 hour it costs  25000 soum .very clean.

name: Ходовой Мотор Workshop
description:
ADMIN Note: This may have been provided by the Owner. 

Very good Workshop. They repair all. Nice and accurate.

name: Hotel Royal Nukus
description:
we paid 4$pp for registration and a hot shower and also wifi!
there is parking all around if you have a big big rig! otherwise we could park with our van Fiat Ducato in front with no problem.
room is Nice and clean...but we didn't sleep!
Nice staff. very helpful. highly recommend.

name: Cheap apartment
description:
Very old and small Place with kitchen (inkl. fridge) one Toilet. One big dark Room just for sleep. One normal Room with coach for sleep as well. Small courtyard. Think two Motocycles are easy to take there. More you can try. But there is some place at the end of the way. You need to walk 30m if you came by car. No Klima. No Wifi. We paid 100.000Som 2 Person p. night. Place for 10person. We were alone.  Sleeping on Carpet. Easy but nice. Very friendly man. 
Need to call him 00998914466321. Because there is no bell to ring. 
We had the place for us alone. At 11 he came to clean the trash.

name: Qishloqqurilidh Bank
description: Good place to get dollars and change dollars and euro for official rate.

name: diesel
description: we could get diesel here, friendly owner, all stations before refused to give diesel from bukhara to here

name: Laundry Service at Asia Hotel Bukhara
description:
At the Asia Hotel Bukhara they offer laundry service. Everything within a few hours.
For prices see the list in the photos.

name: InfinBank
description: Easy money exchange at good rate. we exchanged 100 dollars. no problem.

name: camping
description: nice place with beautiful view, cows,  montains.... quiet , except some trains...close to the railway.

name: quiet place next to the bank
description: If you need to go to the bank and get close for your business, then it's a good place to stay for a night. very quiet, noone will bother you. huge parking, empty, good for big rigs equiped  with their own toilets ! you can find big rubbish bin around the (white) building at the entrance of the parking. playground for children. it's just good to sleep, nothing around

name: Shashlik heaven
description: No clue about the restaurants name but you can recognize the place on the bright lights and green couches with glass tables. Ridiculously delicious and cheap!!

name: Somsa
description: Good stop for nice fresh somsa’s and tea. On the way from Samarkand to Bukhara you see some ovens and plastic tables and chairs on the right side of the road (opposite of the coffee bar).

name: Desert
description: Places in the field. It is hot, but if you can sit in the shade of your car, it's ok. Just off the main road and drive 5 km and then to your right. Everywhere are spots.

name: Joni Osh
description: Local restaurant. Plov center. The best plov in town. All locals come here. Plov usually finishes before 13:30, come earlier.

name: Wild camp between bushes
description: Large clump of bushes. We pitched our tent between the bushes and were well hidden from the road. We turned off the main road on a dirt road about 100m before (a short section of this road is on OSM), and then crossed an open field to reach the bushes. A herd of sheep came through in the evening, and the shepherd stopped by to talk to us. He warned us of some dangerous animal in the bushes (maybe a large yellow spider, which we saw) and said that it was better to camp in the open area, but we didn't move. Nobody else came in the morning before we left.

name: ATM Asaka Bank
description:
Mastercard and Visa cards. cash in Uzbekistan sums. 
it's inside Registan Squere, in Ulugbeka Medrese.

name: shelter in a ruin
description: I drove from Beyneu into Uzbekistan. Unfortunately I couldn't make it before dark to the first next wildcampspot so had to find something myself. This spot is well reachable for bicycles and motorbikes! Far away enough from the road. If you have a small 2-person tent you could camp inside the ruin. See pictures. It's possible that you might get a visit from a camel!

name: small car park
description: Great spot in a small paved car park just down from the yurt camp. Very quiet. Yurt camp charge $25 per person to sleep in yurt (Inc breakfast) $10 for dinner. No mobile coverage.

name: Next to a canal
description: Flat strip of land next to a canal, wide enough to drive on. Access is from a gravel road turning off from the main road. Just before the gravel road crosses the canal, turn left onto the strip of land beside it. Several herds of sheep and cows came through in the evening and morning, but they didn't disturb us. Great spot hidden from the road.

name: Hotel Suyun Ota
description:
Hotel in Ittifak village. Relatively new building, big and clean rooms. Attached bathroom. AC unit installed in the room but cable was too short to plug in. We paid 200,000 Som for a double room. Registration included.

Hotel is attached to an event hall that looks like it is set up for weddings. The place is also on Google maps, with photos there.

name: Beautiful spot by a lake
description: Beautiful spot with many options to stay by a lake with shadow under trees.

name: Nice spot close to the mountains
description: Nice spot close to the mountains hidden from the street in a small valley. Some shepherds and goats but otherwise nobody. Quiet during day and night.

name: TD Motors - motorbike mechanic
description:
This garage was recommended by Uzbekistan motorbike riders club.
+998901683707 Rustam MOTO master - speaks very little English, but is very helpfull.

name: Free parking right next to the Registan
description: Car park (with no barrier/height restriction) right next to the Registan. When we arrived there were some people hanging around and we asked if we needed to pay and they told us it was free. Around 3pm we went back to the car to top up our water bottles and two men (who didn’t look very official) tried to get us to pay them 5000 som for the parking. We refused and walked away. When we went back again later on to leave (around 6pm) those men had gone and nobody asked for payment. There were also some police hanging around just as we left so I think if we were supposed to pay they would have probably said something to us.

name: Diesel station
description: Price 5500S/l. Diesel looks good on the pumpNo diesel Nov ‘19

name: City oil
description: Diesel available for 5600S/liter.  New petrol station.

name: Minimalist Hostel
description:
Nice place to stay in Fergana. We stayed one night for 25$ for a double room with private bathroom. There is also share rooms cheaper. The breakfast was perfect. And you can park your car in front of the hostel. It's safe. 
The owner is very nice and she can  advice you to visit the city and around, and also join you if you want.

name: Optimist Family Guesthouse
description: Small family run guesthouse. Owner is a friendly and hospitable 70 year old man who speaks English very well. He lives with his daughter-in-law and three grandchildren who are world chess champions (play chess with them if you dare!). Two twin rooms and two triple rooms, each with an attached bathroom, but no AC. We could use the kitchen and hang out in the courtyard. We could park our bicycles in the garage, maybe motorcycles could park there too. We booked on Airbnb and breakfast was included.

name: Argo
description: Nice restaurant where you can choose your food.

name: Check point on the way to Monyak/Ship Wreck
description: Check point (military, but possibly due to gas fields around). Very easy to cross. Just asked for direction and camera. Very friendly.

name: Bushes, flat, hidden
description: Follow the trail into the bushes and  choose among many flat spots to camp overnight.

name: Detskiy Park Parking
description: Large un-paved parking lot by park along the canal. Fine for one night. Family with kids would appreciate the playground and wading pool. Good cellular coverage allowing internet.

name: Motorcar Repairs with Restaurant opposite
description: had my wheels rotated and brake pads replaced here. reasonably priced and efficient. They know the basics well.

name: wildcamping at the lake
description:
Nice place to camp, directly at the lake with a sand beach. Soft sand so 4wd recommend.
There are sandpists leeding to it.
Plenty of space for big rigs or multiple cars.

name: Black market Fuel
description:
It is difficult to find Benzin around here! 

Just ask for Benzin at the market. 
We don’t know the quality, but better than nothing

name: Minzifa
description: Really good food. English spoken. Very good service

name: Dizel
description: Diesel available. Som only. More pumps with diesel direction Tasjkent.

name: Luxury Supermarket Kozinka
description: Luxury goods, cheese, nuts, alcohol, muesli, etc. Great to stock up.

name: Agrobank
description: Changes Dollars into Uzs. Good rate. No passport needed.

name: World Guest House
description: Nice place with large garden area, secured parking (highgate), aircon, clean and tidy, small pool, rooms well finished. Bicycle rent. Book on Booking.com, but there they give the wrong gps location! We paid 34$ double, aircon with breakfast (genius deal). Laundry service. Tea with sweets on arrival. Beds are firm.

name: Dizel pump
description: We found diesel here. Locals fuel up their jerrycans for tractors.

name: Boysun Crafts Centre
description: Crafts centre where you can see traditional crafts being made. There is a museum showcasing traditional carpets, embroidery, ceramics, etc from decades ago. The museum also has information about the history and culture of Boysun and the reason it was recognized by UNESCO for its intangible heritage. We paid 20,000 som for 2 people for the museum. Worth a visit.

name: Hotel Ferdavs
description: Nice clean hotel close to the centre of town. Friendly owners. Rooms on second floor, with shared bathrooms on the ground floor. AC only in the common area on the second floor. Big and clean rooms. We paid 150,000 som/night for 2 people. Registration included. We could park our bicycles safely inside. There is a gated parking area next to the hotel that could possibly be used if you are driving.

name: Trucking company
description: Black market diesel at trucking company behind gas station. A local man met at the entrance of town brought us here for 10 000 soms. We bought diesel for 8 000 soms per liter. We bought 50 liters.

name: Hotel Denov
description: Hotel in the centre of town. They have two types of rooms - "economy" rooms with shared bathrooms and no AC, and "standard" rooms with ensuite bathrooms and AC. Price list for both types of rooms are in the photos - the first table is for locals and the second table is for foreigners. The prices are for single and double occupancy respectively. Registration included. Locals' rates range from 50000-170000, Foreigner's 70000-200000

name: Shirkent Hotel
description: Looks like a big fancy hotel but prices are reasonable. Price list is in the photos. Receptionists speak good English. Big and comfortable rooms with AC. Breakfast included. No wifi. Large parking lot in front.

name: AydarKol Lake -Right @the shore
description: Great spot on the shore of Lake Aydar. Only fishermen around and all very nice! Cool nights even when its hot during the day. No facilities.

name: Cafe
description: Cafe just east of the Uzbek border control. Has cold water, soft drinks, beer and reasonable food. Follow signs round the back to entry next to a branch of the Amu-Bukhara canal.

name: Sadaf hotel
description:
Nice hotel for one night. I needed something on my way North and wanted to skip Tashkent (for now) 
They have different prices for locals. Foreigners pay 150.000sum locals pay 120.000 sum, incl breakfast. Rooms are clean, bathroom is ok. They were very nice and of course really surprised about the motorbike. Nice restaurant across the street. Didn't get sick!

name: Kal'ai Mug car park
description: Not a huge car park but enough space to spend the night. we were moved on from 2 other places in this town, but had a peaceful night here.

name: Gas Station
description: Passed it in the opposite direction. Couldn't get there, but lots of cars in front. Always a good sign! They probably have 91 petrol.

name: Lagman House
description: Huge place with big Uzbek selection and an English menu with pictures. Delicious and moderatly priced.

name: UGCC Hotel
description: Good hotel on the road to Nukus although a bit expensive (240.000 som). Card not accepted and no bank nearby. Hotel located in a settlement for the oil refinery located 10 km from here. A store is open until 23:00 100 m from the hotel

name: Toprak Kala Historical Site
description:
Parking Lot of archeological Site and Jurt Camp.
Beautiful Spot between archeological Site and Sunset.
Entrance Fee 2 Euro.  Best shower and flush toilet we had in Usbekistan.

name: Flat area near the road
description: Around 600 m after entering the road to Boysun, on your left side you will see a dirt road entrance. There are plenty of space to pitch a tent (after cleaning some thorns on the ground) or to stop cars and caravans. We were by bike and it was easy to push it around to find a good place. There are no trees and sometimes it is quite windy, but the place is very calm and there is a nice sunset with mountains view.

name: Hostel Giza
description: Hostel Giza, small and bad breakfast, car parking only for large extra fee in yard, noisy room because you somehow could here air condition very very loudly. Bed matress like wood :/. Wouldn’t recommend it at all, overpriced, even though we bargained.

name: Wild camping directly at the lake
description:
Directly on the lake and accessible with 2WD and big rigs directly to the beautifully beach. But we had to clean lots of bottles and other dirt - 30min work.
Local people came during the day - drinking vodka and swimming with music from the car. But they left in the evening and left their bottles on the beach.

name: Chor Bakr Mausoleum
description: Huge parking area for free beside the big complex of Chor Bakr. Green garden around, very quiet for camping and relaxing. Entrance fee 1 Euro. Restaurant near by.

name: Hotel Asia Money Change
description: Inside the Hotel there is now a Bank counter from NBU. They have the best rates we found. Today for Euro 9660.

name: Ayoqsh 121
description: Old fuel station. We got diesel for 6000 Uzs. Petrol pump counter outside does not work. Construction machine is filling up barrels.

name: Watershop
description: 1000 som for 5 Liter. Taste like mineral water. watch out for sign with bottles.

name: Emir Bed and Breakfast
description: Nice BnB where we stayed for almost a week. Breakfast really good and a lot of different things. Safe parking with camera. Mausoleum closely.

name: Water from publib tap
description: Water from public tap directly on the main road. Locals take water here with canisters. Locals drink water.

name: Filtered water
description: Water from a dwell with all the necessary filters. Locals come here to get water. We were able to fill our 200 liters tank. 50 UZS per liter. Opening hours 9:00 to 12:00 and 17:00 to 21:00

name: Farrukh Tschaichana
description: We were traveling with our bicycles on a budget and looking for a place to stay in town. We ask here and we were offered 20$ for a twin room with breakfast included (good!). They have WiFi, AC in the room and a super nice and chilled courtyard (where they let us park our bicycles). The place is super central and people were quite friendly and when understanding we would cycle in the blazing heat, got us some water to take.

name: Shodlik Hotel
description: Hotel clean, basic, with AC ! price 200 000 sum for 2 pers. Welcome is nice. Safe place to store the bikes.

name: At the Beach
description:
Lots of places at the lake. There was some kind of entrance, but we didn‘t understand the guy. We showed him, that we wanted to sleep at the lake and he let us pass. Some locals swimming and grilling, a little bit dirty, no shadow, only bushes.
Water was warm, not really refreshing after a very hot day, but it was relaxing.

name: Desert camp
description: Follow the dirt road up the hill. Hidden from the street, but you can hear the noise. No shadow.

name: Near Termiz at lake
description: Best place near Termiz we could find. At a lake, clear water for swimming, some shadow. In the morning some fisherman passed by, but didn‘t care about us.

name: Next to the street
description: Follow the small dirty road down for some meters, so you are almost hidden behind a hill. Shadow in the morning and in the evening from the mountains. Nothing special, but good for one night.

name: Hotel Kesh Palace
description: Nice and clean, friendly stuff. Paid 36$ for a comfortable double room with private bathroom and AC, including registrstion and breakfast. Across the street is an ATM changing US Dollars into Som.

name: Cafe Lavanda
description: Excellent restaurant, no English but pictures of food. Delicious flavours, food for two hungry bikers with lots of beer 85,000 Som (about $10)

name: Asia Hotel money change
description: There is a Bank counter now from the NBU in the hotel. Best rate today for 1 Euro they changed 9.660 Som.

name: At the lakeshore
description: After the official beachside you see some tracks down to the lakeshore. You will find many possibilities to camp directly at the beach. And after cleaning your 50sqm. it's nice to relax and swimm. During the night you are alone, so it's really quiet.

name: MAN Service Center
description:
Big and professional MAN Workshop. 
Manager Avaz speaks also german and english!
Telephone Manager Avaz: 0099 8977208884 0099 8909372500

name: Xisrav Gas & Petrol Dizel ECO
description: They offer Diesel for 6.000 Som. You can't see from outside, but they have...

name: Korzinka Big Supermarket
description: Very big supermarket, wide range of products, no beer.

name: cool spot on higher altitude
description: Turn off M39 at 39.88245 67.48731 (going to Samerqand you you can not turn left, so you have to pass the intersection and use the u-turn in ca. 300 m), the bad paved road leads to a little village and a small lake, 3,5 km, quiet and cool, 4G with Uzmobile

name: Terrace Restaurant
description:
Good view, good food / dinner, phantastic location, easy style, enjoy your evening. Parked outside with truck on coach parking in front of hotel opposite gate.
Iveco 90-16

name: Train station community
description: Nice people in the middle of no where, established around the small train station. There is water, shadow and in case you can ask some food. Good for cyclists.

name: Metan (метан) - Petrol 80 & Gas
description:
Regular fuel station with both gas and petrol 80. 
Price for petrol in August 2019: 4000 som.

name: Bank (Qishloqqurilishbank)
description: Here you can exchange money for SOM (dollars, euro, pounds etc).

name: Restaurant статус - a super tasty place
description: We had a deliciuos dinner here! Super friendly, Russian speaking staff. Free Wi-Fi. We paid 51 500 UZS for 2 soups, 2 coffees and bread.

name: Timur Guesthouse
description:
Really charming place to stay for a night! Cheap comparing to other accomodation in Moynak. We paid 15$ per night in a double with breakfast (bargained from 20$). Very clean rooms and toilet, breakfast was tasty. Unlimited tea :)

Timur speaks English.

Remember to take off shoes before entering the house.

And there is no sign informing about guesthouse. You need to follow the coordinates or know the exact address of it (A.Temur 42).

name: Gas station with diesel
description: Gas station that sells petrol (80, 91, 95) and diesel. Supposedly good quality, government controlled as told by our mechanic. We had diesel here for 6500 sum/liter.

name: ATM for MasterCard and Visa
description: Next to the Royal Nukus Hotel there is a small kiosk with two ATM’s, one of them accepts MasterCard and Visa!

name: Hotel CAFE
description:
just after passing the border at your left there is a cafe/restaurant with rooms. they showed me on shared room to sleep on the floor but when I say yes they put me in a room for me with air conditioning for the exchange of 12$. it saves you the night if your border pass takes a lot. I am putting 4 stars but not because is fancy, just because it allows you to sleep

beer in the restaurant available!!

name: Hotel Chehra Palace
description: Clean nice 3 star hotel. Nice room great breakfast

name: Dinur Hotel
description: Rooms for $20 for two people with registration. Not negotiable. Rooms have Wi-Fi and AC, shared bathroom with the cafe next door, not very good. Beds are just a fold out couch / futon. Wouldn't recommend.

name: Nukus Hotel
description: Big fancy looking hotel.  They have nicer rooms for $30 per night for two people with air-conditioning (officially $50 but they lowered right away to $30).  We chose the cheaper rooms for $24 per night for two people, no air-conditioning.  All the cheap rooms are in the basement, old furniture, does not look like what you'd expect based on the hotel lobby and exterior.  But fine nonetheless.  WiFi is so-so.  We found a fan in the hallway and kept us cool at night.  Good value for the area.  Big parking lot in front.

name: Khivat
description: Nice hôtel for more or less 20$ in the center of the old City, open 24h/24

name: Lakeside camping
description: Very nice spot at a lake. Lots of trees for shadow and plenty of room for camping with tent, van or truck. Track thru town is sand so might be muddy after rain but when dry its an easy drive also for two wheel drive. When I was here some local men were having a barbecue and invited me to share their food. This to me assumed it was all okay. Popular spot for swimming so perfect after a day in the heat.

name: Cheap Cayhana near the Siab Bazaar
description:
Very tasty and very cheap food, really recommended!

Shashlik 8000/1 UZS
Laghman 12000 UZS
Beer 9000 UZS
+10% service fee.

name: East Star Khiva Hostel
description:
~$9.33 per dorm bed per night.
New hostel in Khiva.  Outside the old town.  Nice and new beds, sheets, bathroom, etc.  Air-conditioning.

name: Wild Camp
description:
wild camp, cannot get any further along the road. April 2019. a Sunday, it has rained more than usual this last few weeks in this desert area. This means that a once in every 10 years or so a carpeting of green grass and poppies galore wherever you look.  The weather has been very hot this weekend so thousands of families travelling crammed into every form of transport have been out driving to have picnics and pick flowers. The road up to this spot was heaving, but most left as it was going dark. Visited by the police who were just being inquisitive and very friendly. You cannot access the petroglyps via this road as an army camp is in the way.  The road ends in a carpark outside the gates to it.
The police said we had to go back down the road a bit, to where the red warning sign is on the I-Overlander map and drive around to that way. We will do this tomorrow. Visited by a family barbecuing nearby with a kebab of meat pieces for each of us.  I would guess that normally this place will be virtually deserted normally.

name: Diesel
description: 10 august 2019: diesel available, although it may be only temporary bc.  a handwritten sign was placed in front  of the station.. expensive: 120 000 sum/ 20L

name: Shaboda restaurant - burgers, wraps, fries, pizza
description:
Nice restaurant with tasty burgers and fries. Did not try anything else though.

Everything seemed clean, they had shade and watersprayers keeping it reasonably cool.

Prices were 28000 for burger with fries.

name: Samsa and sandwiches restaurant
description:
Good and cheap place where to eat Samsa (samossa), sandwiches and salad. Count 15 or 20 000 SOM for 1 person.
Very small place located outside the supermarket but still in the same building, facing the main street.

name: Complex near the road
description:
Right next to the M35 road, brand new " shopping mall" owned by a family (Russian speaking, only the daughter speaks a bit of English).
You will find here everything you need :
- Free toilets (clean!)
- Mini Market
- Pharmacy
- Hairdresser
- Video Games room
- Probably a restaurant, but only in the evening

The "shopping mall" is closed during the hottest part of the day.

name: MAX hostel
description:
Brand new hostel, extremely clean. Friendly staff. Water and coffee for free.

1 room for 4 people - 33$ (including 8$ tax) with breakfast, shower gel, shampoo and slippers (like in a hotel).

name: Lagman Restaurant
description: Good local restaurant, modern looking, specialized in Lahman. The homemade Noodles are made in the open kitchen (you see them making it). Prices 15.000-25.000 som. It's Halal.

name: Big city market
description:
Khiva local market. You will find food and much more as well as some small restaurants (start line, kebabs...). 
Better go there on mornings.
Many minibuses from there to Khiva to bring your dozen of watermelons back home.

name: Motosalon.uz - the best mechanic for motorcycles (recommended by local community)
description:
Ivan is well-known, very good local mechanic, recommended to us by Uzbek motorcyclists. Speaking russian only.

He helped us with leaking radiator and leaking water pumps in our BMW F650GS.

Whatsapp:
+998 90 324 55 47

It's not easy to find him, ask the guy at the gate where is Ivan's workshop and he will help you.

name: Fair priced restaurant with nice atmosphere
description: Nice restaurant with normal and chilled tables (the name might be Kheivak Café, not sure). They have local and international food - fries are 5000. Kebab between 8000 and 12000. Most local dishes below 18000.

name: Nazira Guesthouse
description: Very nice family guesthouse. It was $10 per person including breakfast. Nice double rooms with ensuite, AC, wifi, and view of a madressa from the window. Seems to have been just built - everything is very new and clean. The breakfast alone is probably worth $10 each and changes each day - we've had omelettes, crepes, crispy fried little potato dumplings, fruits and nuts, tea and coffee and bread. Much more than we could possibly eat. There is a small space behind a gate where we could park our motorcycle. The family is lovely and have a young son who speaks quite good English. It was easy to get here via the east gate which seems to be in the process of getting bricked closed at the moment. The south gate seems to still work. There is room out front to park a vehicle or two and the street is not busy.

name: National Food, National Prices
description: Actually an affordable restaurant in Uzbekistan!  Very reasonable prices, especially for the touristy area.  Nice owner.  Fresh and good food.

name: Atlas Hotel - ATM
description: ATM gives som to foreign ATM cards.  the ATM actually explicitly says there is 0% fee to take out money.  But then when you take out Uzbek Som, it converts it to USD and charges you in USD and uses a bad exchange rate.  So it cost us about 5% due to the bad exchange.

name: Octane 91
description: petrol station with octane 91. good service. paid 124000 som for 25 litres.

name: 95 and 91 Petroleum
description: Big petrol station. They didn’t have 91 but 95. Paid 7200 per liter.

name: Mehmonxona Shurchi
description:
Hostel looking bad outside but very clean and confortable inside !
Seems being open 24/24, we arrived around 2 am and main door sas open.
Free car park on demand at 20 meters of main entrance.
We paid 240 000 Soms for two people with private bathroom and shower, Wi-Fi.

name: Inside Food Market
description: Small restaurant in the food market for local workers. Menu : Plov or Shaslish, for +/- 25.000 sums per person.

name: Mausoleum
description: Pretty garden with museums. Main entrance in the gardens is free.

name: Karatepal
description: Old Buddist temples with great view on Afghanistan. 7000 Sum per capita

name: Beeline SIM card
description: Beeline 2nd Uzbek operator. 3Go =35 kSUM good network coverage

name: UCell Tourist SIM
description:
Booth of UCell on the square which sells tourist SIM cards. 3 different deals:
-Small: 2gb internet + 2gb for facebook and whatsapp for 25 000 som + 4000 som for Sim
- Medium: 5 Gb+5 Gb for 54 000 som
- Large:10 GB + 10 Gb for 84 000 som

Passport needed. More info see picture ;)

name: The oasis garden
description:
You'd better like ourdoor restaurant with live music. We had a great time.
Westernized restaurant with food from Italy to Japan. Including premium quality for shashlick-addicts.
Prices +/- Plantan restaurant

name: Aysel Art Gallery
description: Really artist loft, dancing the Registan. Living artists exhibits: paintings, sculptures, textiles

name: Parivash Family Guest House
description: Family Guest house located in the center of Bukhara. Really nice and friendly owner. They can fit 3 or 4 motorcycles in a private space just in front of the rooms. I paid 10 dolars for a single room breakfast included, and very good breakfast. Highly recommend

name: MAN service
description: MAN service. We did oil change here and some small work on the truck (MAN TGM 13-290). They do not speak English but are very nice and ready to help you.

name: ATM Kapital Bank
description: ATM takes visa Card. You can get sum or dollars.

name: Parking lot - Tashkent
description: We stayed there two nights before and after a visit to MAN Service, few km away to change oil and do some work on the truck. It's not the dream bivouac, but it's quiet at night and right next to a good restaurant.

name: Full service laundromat
description: For those who don’t go to hostel there is a possibility to get laundry done here. Enter the green gate and cross the courtyard. Full service. Do not speak English but very nice people. Price is by piece but we got a price for about 8 kg: 200000 UZS. Also they accepted to do it overnight. Dropped it about 7 pm and got it back between 9 and 10 am.

name: Big Roadside Restaurant
description:
Improbable roadside restaurant with an Eiffel Tower in the courtyard.
Big space with shadow in the backyard. Good food. Served quickly.

name: Вчлканзациг ьалансировка
description: Gentles mecanik guys to fix car issues. Very kind, efficient and cheap

name: Hostel / restaurant / Mecaniks stuff
description: Place have rooms, restaurant, eat and drink to take away, cigarettes, and pieces for cars / moto

name: Camp behind bushes
description: A lot of bushes next to the road with some space to pitch a tent. Some trucks and a shepherd passed by at the road during the evening, but we were not seen. Some barking dogs far away during the night.

name: Registration - Malika Hotel
description: Very nice guy at the reception who would not do the registration without staying there. But he accepted paying with its ouzbek card so I could register through the website elehmon.uz. The best solution. Thanks to him.

name: Money exchange at good rate
description: National Bank. Small office in the third arche. Good rate. No fee. Much better than all the ATM where they pretend no fees but debit you in dollars at terrible exchange rate.

name: campsite at the river
description: Great place on the road between Bukhara and Samarkand around Navoiy. Just take left on the mainroad, then right and just follow the road. You can see the dirt track on maps.me but not on Google maps. Just follow the dirt road and you end up at the river. A few shepperds past in the evening and the morning.

name: Islam Khodja Guesthouse
description: Very new and super clean guesthouse. Nice staff. It’s inside the city walls near the South Gate. Cars and big rigs can park in front. For Motorcycles and bicycles there is a small closed garage.

name: Gross Insurance
description: Compulsory 3rd party liability. Paid 11,200c for 15 days for a Land Cruiser.

name: Diesel from Canister
description:
A friendly guy sweared it’s good diesel. 
6.000sum per liter. Must have had >400L in canisters

name: Ceramic center
description: Fairly authentic artisan center for ceramic making. It’s a family run business. They also serve lunch. Cool stop on the way to Samarkand

name: abu lays samarqandiy antique shop
description: very beautiful, authentic special shop for old uzbek and turkmen textiles, antique kaftani, ceramic plates. Honest price. don't miss it !

name: Hamkorbank VISA ATM
description: 24/7 ATM for only VISA card. Could withdraw UZS.

name: Exchange ATM
description: Exchange Atm, put in USD and get back SOM. I combined this with the mastercard USD only atm to get som in Central Khiva. Rate 8500.

name: Said Motorcycle Repair
description: Not a lot of places for motorcycle in Uzbekistan. Said is a nice young man who loves motorcycle. He doesn’t have much to work with, but with his friends he will do everything he can to help you. Note that you won’t find any parts for your bike nor motorcycle oil. I was there quite a long time and I am happy to say that I now have friends in Andijan. Boris

name: Car Bazaar
description: Car Bazaar with basic stuff. Fluid, screws, filters,...

name: Diesel at old station
description: We just tanked diesel here for 6000 som/l. First one with diesel we could find from Buchara (we also checked the other ones on iOverlander)

name: Agrobank
description: Exchange Dollars, Euros to S'om. They also have an external 24/7 ATM but it was out of order when we were there.

name: Mountains
description: Good flat spot in the mountains with really nice view. A bit windy. Sometimes 4G connection sometimes no connection at all.

name: Great fast food
description: If you are on the way to Bishkek and want a fast and good „Döner“ go to this place! They call it burger and its very busy here.

name: Shahslik Oshhona
description: Very fresh salads and bread, delicious soups and beef, lamb and chicken shahsliks. Beer is cold. Super bonus, no tourists only locals :-). Walking distance from old town, next to Bolohovuz mosque. Don’t know if it is open for lunch. We only had diner here (twice). Good price versus quality.

name: Sarrafon Local Restaurant
description: Local restaurant with local prices. Classic Uzbek dishes for around 12 000 sum for a main meal. Also a lot of salads available. Simple but good. You cannot miss it because of the big mama on the terrace inviting you in ;)

name: Chilpiq ‘tower of silence’
description:
About 1 kilometer west of the main road stands an ancient tower of silence. These towers were built by zoroastriens for their sky burials, giving the dead bodies to the vultures. Although the ruins are in far worse shape than the towers of silence in Yazd (Iran), it’s worth to stop on your way to Moynaq. You have also a nice view over the Amu-Darya riverbed.

Entrance is free, but they are working on a concrete stairs so I expect that a small entrance fee will be asked in the future.

name: Zoo house/ pet store
description: Here you can by food for your furry friend.

name: Green bear bar
description:
Great restaurant/bar which has very good food and an excellent service.
not really expensive and every cent worth of it.
Highly recommended!

name: Next to Chilpik Dakhma (Fortress)
description: pretty cool place to camp, lots of more or less flat spots aroud the fortress. Other side of the fortress might be cooler for sunset ;) not much firewood around. some construction work going on, might get fenced in in future but right now it's free.

name: Fish restaurant - beautiful setting beside lake
description: this restaurant is located right next to a very beautiful lake, you will be seated in a private little hut directly on the shore. very nice setting, especially at sunset!! you can choose your fish from a little pond and they will then prepare it for you. no English, no Menue but very friendly service. speaking some Russian might help, we ended up getting our fish battered and deep fried but they have a grill so it was probably just the language barrier. very cheap too, payed 135.000 for two big fish, 3 salads, beer and a bottle of vodka.

name: On sandroad next to lake
description:
just beside the sand road (that probably goes all the way around the lake) you will find some spots to camp without blocking the road. In the evening the owners of the land came by, very frindly and seemed to be okay with us camping here. not really possible to get further away from the road but very quiet, one car in the morning. might be some nicer spots further down the road, didn't check. 
beautiful fish restaurant nearby.

name: Wonderful camping at small lake
description:
Stunningly beautiful and peaceful place to spend a few days. This place is some kind of national park / nature reservat, so please behave accordingly and don't leave any trace. It's wonderfully clean, not a single piece of trash around! Fishing is not allowed (this seems to be very important to the people here) but camping and swimming is perfectly fine. Forgot to ask about fires, not much wood around anyways though.. 
very quiet and natural, except for some small boats in the distance. There are two or three houses in sight but quite far from this spot. 
No shade at all and some mosquitos around in the evening but the views and beautiful sunsets make up for that ;) 
Easily reachable for any kind of car when it's not raining. Approx. 1.5 hours off main road samarkand - Tashkent.

name: Money Change USD to Som and atm
description: atm in hotel lobby that also changes USD to uzbek sum at the rate of 8400 (8500 is official rate, june 2019). haven't tried withdrawing cash

name: overlooking the lake
description:
wonderful campspot, forget the other one we posted at this lake, this one is waaay nicer! ;) no water, no shade but a truely magical view over the turquoise lake! 
some Sheppards with their flock and dogs passed at night and early morning, other than that really quiet

name: next to river
description:
very nice flat spot next to wonderfully clear river with nice views of the mountains. The spot is on the other side of the river, but still in sight of the road. You  can hide behind some trees but since there is nothing going on on the road not necessary. Some fields nearby, but nobody there when we stayed here. Also has some old camp fires, probably the field workers or some locals come here frequently. To get there you have to use a very very small bridge (our Toyota land cruiser J6 barely made it through) so not accessible with wide vehicles). there is another wooden bridge for wider vehicles but we wouldn't recommend it :D
didn't check but probably also possible to cross river without bridge with some ground clearance or 4x4. also possible to camp behind abandoned building without crossing but not as nice. About 4 km further towards base camp there are plenty other nice spots along the road.

name: just before base camp
description: beautiful views of the mountains, next to river (in full view of the street, but as mentioned in the other spot, not many cars passing by). two cars and some cows passed in the evening. we camped on the other side of the river, easy to cross a few meters downstream, water was less than knee high when we were here. nicer views, but less secluded than the other spot we posted.

name: Khiva Tosh Darvoza
description:
Family owned guesthouse inside the gates. Opened only 2 months ago in summer 2019. They have place for one car parked outside right in front of the hotel. They have a camera pointing at it 24/7 which is shown on a tv screen near the reception area.

Nice rooms and bathrooms (good shower) and good breakfast.

name: carousel hotel
description:
Open in september 2019, very new hotel in antique madrassa, just near the main gate to the citadel. Very nice place, rooms are with private modern bathroom with good and big shower. Free wifi.
The owner, very gentle person, allowed us to camp in his beautiful and absolutely quite courtyard . Enough space for big rigs. Very happy staying here, considering there are no more options for overlander in Khiva

name: good mechanic
description: good mechanic and very nice person. He changed our fuel filter, cleaned air filter . very quick service, paied 5 US dollars

name: Mountainside.
description: Beautiful place. Large flat area. Finally some mountains after mostly flat Uzbekistan coming from Turkmenistan. Few friendly locals and their dogs are curious but welcoming. Stars and quiet at night.

name: Diesel
description: Diesel from the pump. Next to the bazaar. On the sign it also says dizel.

name: Very good somsa, very nice people
description: Delicious if not the best somsa we had in Uzbekistan. Also super nice mint tea in very clean pot and cups. People are super friendly.

name: Kamila Hostel
description: Nice place to stay for a rest. Good wifi. Privat shower and toilet. You can use the kitchen and make your laundry. Fill up water. Not in the center so quiet neighborhood. Park in front of the hostel (2.8m high). Nice and friendly family. Shop and restaurant near.

name: Asia Alliance Bank
description: ATM outside and cash exchange office inside. Good rate.

name: Ucell/Beeline provider
description: You can buy a SIM card here. We paid 90k Som for 10 gb + additional 10 for social networks

name: Kumush
description:
Good food with dishes such as plov, lagman, manty and a lot of other stuff (chicken with fries, meat with potatoes etc). I ordered plov for 15000, green/black tea is 2000.
Free WiFi! Friendly staff.

name: The Silk Road Kokand Hotel
description: this place is amazing. the “single” room is 440,000 sum for two people (twin), doubles and triples for 490,000 to 550,000. The service here is wonderful. We usually go budget class everywhere but we came here for my birthday and it's well worth the extra to relax after the pamir. they realised it was my birthday from my passport and came to us at 8pm in our room with free champagne and huge slices of cake. such a lovely and thoughtful surprise. they have an onsite restaurant and the food is really good and very cheap. they told us they want more bikers here so they gave us a discount on the room, unasked, and let us park the bike out back right outside the room door. best place we've stayed in central Asia, by far.

name: Diesel station
description: Got diesel here. Maybe a little bit expensive (8500 per Liter) but everything else in this area was empty!

name: Xalq Bank
description: Large bank near the intersection. Exchange counter inside (would not exchange Tajik somoni!). ATM outside which accepts Maestro, MasterCard, and Visa, which can also exchange USD to the local currency.

name: Mannam
description: Korean restaurant in a nice courtyard just off the Main Street. Prices between 20 and 30 thousand som, not bad but not special. Very authentic tho.

name: Central Asian Plov Center
description: Huge restaurant, plov is the only meal you can get :) price 16-26k Som, menu in photos. In front of the restaurant there are chefs with huge plov pots.

name: Petrol station
description: we have found diesel on this station. very nice people

name: Diesel and petrol
description: Diesel and petrol available July 2019. two stations after the way to castles

name: Zoocenter Veterinarnaja
description: English speaking vet with a lot of experience. Very friendly and professional. Recommended!

name: Registration
description: Payraviy Hostel was the only of around 20 we asked to do our registration. They do it for 5USD

name: Hostel Bukhara Gold
description: Looks great 22+ bed dorm, 4 bed dorm,  6 bed dorm, doubles. quiet enough during my visit though. Good wifi, mediocre breakfast, close to the metro and center. Showers, western toilet and friendly staff. Paid $7 for the night!

name: Tap with clear water
description: Ask to the owner before, but it's ok. Clear water.

name: Fuel station with DIESEL
description: After we tried all other fuel stations here in the app, only this one had diesel. 6000 Som per liter. We were able to fill the tank completely

name: Toshkent backpackers hostel
description:
Hostel with daily cleaned showers and two, four and 12 people dorming rooms available. Breakfast included between 8 - 13 $/ night.
We we're travelling with our dogs and this was the only place in Tashkent that was ready to give us accomodation during the waiting process for our visa. The owner and the manager speak perfect english, russian, turkish, usbek, pakistani and many more.
Felt very well and highly recommend this place ;)

name: Water pump by the road
description: Water tap by a small building, really good pressure.

name: Fuji Film Passport photo
description: Four minutes passport photo print. English speaking staff and cheap.

name: Akant Guest house
description: Very nice hostel with private bathroom, 11$. Manager is very nice

name: Riverside flat campsite
description: Place close to the river so you can wash yourself. River is very clean... You are behind the trees, dogs on the otherside barked a little but shut up during the night.

name: Nargis
description: Small Hostel over a Shop, 10$ per night. Clean and near many shopping sites, not very quiet. Parking outside with camera.

name: Dilnura Kafesi
description: Really nice local restaurant, non-touristic. They have some Khiva-only dishes, so it’s a nice change from plov and shashlik. Fair prices, we paid 45000 (under $5) for 2 main dishes, appetizer and tea.

name: Asaka Bank
description:
After going to five banks and the airport we were directed here. 
At the counter by the entrance you can pay by card (Mastercard and Maestro accepted) and they give USD! Usd were sold for 9460 and they charged a small commission (around 1.4%).
They speak Russian and a little bit of English.

In general, apparently, they only exchange som into usd for Uzbek, tourists are not allowed to exchange into usd.

name: Great view on mountains and dam
description:
Follow the dirty track from the main road (no problem with 2wd and motorhome). You can go on top of the little hill for a 360° view on the dam, the lake and the mountains, or stay at the feet of the hill to be hide from the road.
Internet 3g with Beeline (no reception with UMS).

name: Beautiful view on valley and mountains
description: At the pass, just follow the walking path till the end.

name: House Hostel
description:
9USD (tax included) for a night in 10 bed mixed dormitory. But we paid 8USD with booking.com genius discounts. 
Simple breakfast is included in the price and there is also flushing sitting toilets & hot showers. Overall the hostel is clean and tidy and the receptionists are very helpful.

name: Chinor Guesthouse
description: Cozy guesthouse in suburban area. Spacious twin room for 20USD a night. (Note: booked online, might be able to negotiate if you come here directly.) Flushing sitting toilet and showers are outside of room. There is even a sauna where the shower is but may be extra charge if you want to use it. Breakfast available at an extra 2USD.

name: Restaurant with very good Comca/Samsa
description:
Restaurant with very good Comca/Samsa
And the people are very kind.

name: Dzhampyk Kala Fortress
description: Wild camp next to the massive fortress walls with great views of the Baday-Tugay Reserve. There are various camping spots, even within the fortress. On the other side of the fortress there is a small yurt camp, but there was no one there when we visited mid-October. No 4WD necessary, tracks on OSM are accurate with several shortcuts.

name: Highest point in the Zomin NP
description:
This is the highest point of the road through the Zomin NP, 2.490m. The road is all tarmac in uzbek conditions...
You are only allowed to make a transit drive, because it's a military area! No hiking, no mountaineering, no camping!

name: Roziya Guesthouse
description:
Very large, modern, luxury apartment run by friendly and hospitable family. Very new build, I think I was first ever guest in September 2019. It is maybe 2km out from the main city centre but quality is high. They made great meal for me, but there is a large kitchen so you can probably self-cater. Secure parking in courtyard. Roziya speaks good English.
Phone +998 91 1197979

name: photo gallery
description: wonderfull gallery with amazing picture of people from buchara and landsacape. visit this peacefull place.

name: Djanbas Kala
description: Beautiful fortress in the middle of the desert. You can come here only for photos or you can sleep everywhere you want, even inside the fortress if you want/can.

name: Vobkent Minarett
description: This old Minarett (year 1199!) is about 40 meters high and worth to visit if you pass at the main road on your way from or to Buchara.

name: Restaurant along the road
description: Large restaurant, very good food! Highly recommend. Looks to be family run. 60,000 for 2 to eat very well. Also available cold drinks, alcohol, tea etc.

name: Restaurant on the roadside
description:
This is a great place to eat! Fresh bread, fresh tomatoes for salad and beautifully cooked lamb. Highly recommend.

47,000 som for 2 to eat well . We had 3 lamb kebabs/shashkik.

name: Good clean cafe with large garden
description:
This is a great spot for lunch!

The cafe is very clean and the menu looks good - kebab for 10,000 som or Lagman for 10,000 som.

Staff are very helpful.

name: Alskom
description: We paid 22,400 som (2.3$) for 2 months. (It's the minimon they do).

name: carbox
description: A large garage that gives many services, certified work, do a good job!

name: Mikrokreditbank ATM
description: ATM which takes Visa and also exchanges currency.

name: Water pump on the street
description: Public water, several in this area (for example on the other side of roundabout). We were told it's drinkable. Better ask again.

name: Old cemetery
description: It is not really a tourist attraction. Anyway it's an interesting place to visit in this desert area on a way to Moynaq.

name: Hostel Alsys
description:
Brand new hostel, open one month so very clean. We arrived as five cycle tourers, bikes stored inside the hostel. 

On arrival we were told price was 150000 Som each, this was brought down to 100000. We were the only people here, however having spoke to the staff there are usually more guests.

name: химчистка
description: Laundry service. Washing drying. Dry cleaning. Didn't use it, only walked by.

name: Sierra Camping Shop
description: Camping supplies, tents, sleeping bags, liners, burners, socks, pillows, sleeping mats, etc.

name: Diesel
description:
Diesel available 8th Nov 19. 7200som per litre.
Got 80 litres.

name: Zoomagazin
description: Here you can get dog and catfood. There are also some Vet Docs as well as a pharmacy for pets around.

name: Water
description: Water coming out of a pipe right next to the road. Crystal clear mountain water.

name: Water
description: Two pipes coming down from the mountain with crystal clear water.

name: Korzinka Supermarket
description: Very well stocked supermarket with super friendly manager who assigned me an employee to walk me through the store to help translate things that were on Uzbek or Russian. Fresh meat, fresh fish, veggies, fruit, cheese whatever you need they have it.

name: Bicycle and Motorcycle Parts
description:
Small bicycle and motorcycle shop. Small parts in stock, but the owner speaks English and can connect you with locals and shops that will have what you need. More bicycle parts than motorcycle parts.

Many bicycles and motorcycles parked in front behind a fence.

name: Very nice tea house with great sweets
description: Beautiful, clean, very nice smelling tea house. Lovely sweets.

name: Kafe Okean
description:
Good quality food, fast service, full menu, cold drinks (even in November!). Owner speaks good English. 

Pelmini 10000
Beef shashlik 8000
Rice 2000
'Korean-style' Carrot salad 8000
Onions 500
Bread 1500
Black tea 1500
Lots of other options too. 

Open 9am-10pm

name: Guesthouse Nika CHEAP
description:
Clean, new guesthouse with covered, gated parking for 6 cars or 24 motorcycles. Gate is for cars only, ~2.1m high. Larger vehicles can park in driveway, pretty safe. (The family parks their car outside overnight.) Grandson speaks great English. 

$10pppn in private rooms with shared bathroom. Breakfast +$2.50. By FAR the cheapest place in town, and it's a great one too!

name: Near Road
description: A good camping spot. It was a little bit windy when we were there. You can be seen from the road but its far enough away.

name: Local Park
description: It is a Parking place in front the hotel Atlas and  near the Local park. We stayed here for 1 night. nobody bothered us. It was a quiet and good night. No facilities. Toilet in the park.

name: Boyjon Ota
description: This is a family hostel, very pleasant, very clean,  and very good breakfast included! The owner, charming people, have helped us very much! Only single beds, $ 10 for bed. There is parking!

name: Desert Overlook
description: Gravel campspot/plateau with great overlook of the desert. Follow the Tarmac until you find the gravel track leading to this place on the right. Follow it for ~800m.

name: Diesel Fuel Station
description: Petrol station supplying diesel (not sure about the quality, I'll be able to tell you in a few km)

name: A good car mechanic
description: We reached him to fix a bear in the wheel, professional mechanic, help us find the part. A very pleasant man, talking only to Uzbek

name: Registan Hostel
description:
This is a brand new hostel directly located next to Registan. 
The hostel has a real nice design and offers three dorms with 6 beds each. 
Room with lockers in dorms. Registan Hostel is brand new so everything is super clean and cosy, 
we have curtains for every bed, which is much privacy. Kitchen is also brand new and well equipped. 
The shower is upper standard with great water pressure. 
The place has air-conditioning everywhere and even central heating. Friendly, helpful staff. 
Great location in between Timur's mausoleum and the Registan Square!

Moreover, Registan Hostel offers additional separate services such as washing machine, kitchen, shower, parking and registration for those who travel by car.

name: Small supermarket
description: Small supermarket close by the old town. Mainly necessity items.

name: Water pump
description: Pump attached to a well. there are a couple along the road, this is just one of them.

name: Beachside
description: Little "beach" on the river side close by the city. Little hard  sand (winter time) beach a few km away from Nukus. We found this place in the middle of the night so don't have big expectations. But it's flat, quiet, and easy to access.

name: Veterinary
description: Here you can get a health certificat for your hairy friend. It is the only vet in Nukus.

name: Local restaurant Oshhona/ very good shahslik
description: Very nice restaurant, little to no tourist. Shahslik, salads, tea all with love and therefore super tasty. Also serve beer, tasty sourpa and Lagman. Service is with a smile! Next to the Bolo hauz Mosque. Lunch and diner.

name: Car Bazaar. Shops and Work shops
description: Shops and Work shops. Couldn't find what I need for my Diesel car but many spares, tires and workshops

name: Track to go down to the sea bed. Flat in the bottom
description:
Here you'll find a track going down to a flat and quite place. Possiblity to go a little bit further in the "desert/sea bed" but the sand is really soft, be careful. 
Big rig, go to check before.

name: Close to the Park and Bazaar
description:
Nice place to stay, we were 3 nights at this place. In the morning and at the daytime there is many traffic about this Bazaar but at the night is very silence.
When you will drive early in the morning it is no problem but at the daytime could be a little bit difficult to parking. Cars park around you. Look at the picture. 😊

name: River bank
description: very nice and quiet spot on meadow between bushes. Stayed here for 2 nights totally undisturbed.  very peaceful spot.  With 4WD you can camp on the river bank

name: Asia Insurance
description:
O. Makhmudova street, 18.
Bought compulsory vehicle insurance here. Friendly staff, English spoken here. 15 days insurance cost 8000 Som for 20 days.

name: Diesel
description: Got Diesel here on 30.11.19. Not too many fuel stations nearby.

name: propane
description: Refilled my propane bottle. Had suitable adapter. my bottle has tajik fittings

name: SIM-Card Shop
description:
Friendly, good english speaking girl runs a UCell shop.
She provides you with all information you need for selecting your tarif with providers.

Lots of space for parking.
ATM also in the village.

10 gb tourist-sim - 85000 som

name: Gross Car Insurance
description:
Fast and friendly. 
Cheif speaks German.
30000 som for 1 month - old Mercedes 3,5t.

name: Big Pipe
description:
Road to Taras . Trucks and locals stopping here for get water.
We filled our tank - Okt. 2019

name: Art Hostel
description:
Very clean and foreigner-oriented hostel with swimming pool in the yard :-)
We payed 6$+2$ tax per night and person in the dorm, a double is 17+2$, BREAKFAST BUFFET INCLUDED.
They have safe parking in the yard for cars, vans, motorbikes and bicycles.
Washing machine, aircon, fast WiFi, comfortable living room and nice yard to socialize, big kitchen and very clean bathrooms with very hot very good showers. Towels are changed every day. 
Very peaceful and safe area, close to Supermarket and Kosmonaut‘s metro station.
Staff speaks fluently English and is very helpful.

name: Wishbone german coffee&cake
description:
Wishbone coffeeshop with real coffee, matcha latte and real german treats such as Apfelstrudel, Marmorkuchen (marble cake), Rüeblikuchen (carrot cake) and other things you might have missed in the last months. All made with real german recipes, so kilos less sugar than all cakes you had during the last thousands of kilometers :-)

They also serve light snacks like gazpacho or sandwiches. 

Not too expensive (Apfelstrudel is 14000) and you can sit on a little terrace outside or inside in the cool historical building.

name: Cinnamon Cafe
description:
Real coffee, good cakes, burger, huuuuge Pizza and other western food.
Not too expensive: 1 cappuccino + cake = 2,20€ :-)
Can be crowded but it’s worth waiting for a table.

name: Supermarket
description: Anything you can imaging. Quite big and well sorted supermarket.

name: Lagman Markazi
description:
Very good local place for Lagman, Manti, fresh salad, local food.
Very clean, big portions and good price. 1 big plate of Lagman, not oily and with a lot of vegetables is 16,000, see pictures.
Yummie place!

name: Loft
description:
For all those creeping for western food, this is the right place:
real coffee
Burgers
Pizza
Pasta
fresh Salads (2 pages on the menu!)
homemade lemonade and other yummieh stuff.
English menue, English speaking staff.

name: Embassy of Kazakhstan
description:
The embassy of Kazakhstan moved to this place. 
For visa inquiries use entrance at the left side of building.
Opening hours 9-12
You need an appointment for any visa related issues.

name: Beach camping
description:
There is a little platform to put your tent, but the beach is huge so you can camp anywhere.
In May the water was too cold to swim, but locals were brave enough :-) 
There is some shade under trees.
A lot of resorts around, but enough dirt tracks going down to the beach. No 2WD needed, we went with a teeny-tiny Chevrolet and made it :-) 
Maybe it’s crowded on weekends.
Strong Beeline LTE signal.

name: Guten (german Restaurant)
description:
It’s a typical german beergarden on the shore of a river under trees, so it’s fresh an shady on hot summer days. Indoor seating also available.
They serve typical german dishes: meat, sausages, Schnitzel, salads,... and brew their own beer.
Menu is in Russian only, but waiters speak very good english and will help.
Nice place down by the river for cold beer and without plov or lagman :-)

name: UMS mobile
description: Here The office, very professional guys. I paid 8gb for 47000som.

name: Iran fee bank
description: Here you pay the fee to apply Iranian visa. Important: you can pay only in euro, no dollars!!! Bring euro with you!!!

name: Get dollars from VISA
description: In NBU bank you can get dollars from your VISA card. It looks 1% fee

name: Get dollars from cash
description:
And here, MILLY BANK, finally you can change your Som in dollars without any “registratizia”

Ciao

name: Pastisserie & coffee
description:
Hete it’s very good option to have breakfast at good price but very western standards. Different cakes, croissants or English breakfast.

Ciao

name: Get SOM from MASTERCARD
description:
Here you can use your MasterCard to get Som. as usual from 1st October 2019, to change them in dollars you must go to a bank.

Ciao

name: Get Som with MasterCard
description:
You cow use your MasterCard at Asaka bank’ atm
Ciao

name: Tools for electronic devices
description:
Here, SP PHONE, you can find tools (screwdrivers etc) and spare parts for your phone 

Ciao

name: Sasha guide
description: I met Sasha in “khiva yoqut Guest house”. He is a 24 guy graduated at university and during his free time he is a local guide. He speaks English, and very interesting going around with him. His local/whatsup number is +998995047922. The price is 10$ each person for 3 hours tour, it really worths!!!

name: Change dollars
description:
In the small market you can change dollars in local money: 1$=18

DON’T CHANGE IN THA BANKS!!!

name: Cafe restaurant
description:
Good place to eat something or take a brake

Enjoy

name: Museum of fine arts
description:
Nice (better say “imperial”) museum where you can find nice paintings and sculptures. It’s not Louvre, but it worths. Entrance is 10$, but I insisted to pay in manat so I paid 40manat... you can take pics. 

Day off: Tuesday. Open 9-18

name: Water source
description: In the middle of nowhere. Three water sources. Salty but a lot of water pumped from the ground.

name: Ishonch (trust)
description: Full service laundry. $5 for a big bag of laundry. Washing and drying.

name: Quiet Camp by the Syr Dayra River
description: Quiet and fairly secluded spot on the bank of the Syr Darya river. Flat ground for tents and potentially for camper van. Nice view of the mountains and river. Phone service available on Beeline UZ network.

name: Shaded river camp
description: Just of the main gravel road. A small forested area with a clean river running through. Ample space to park. You can cross (4x4) the river and have an even nicer spot.

name: Free parking and camping close to Registan
description:
free parking close to registan. Very quiet place by the park. It is possible to sleep here in the vehicle,  no problems very quiet.

the entrance is right at the corner, a bit narrow, but you will see other local cars.

accessible by big rigs as well.

name: Working ATM
description: We were able to take 2 000 000 per card here. This is probably your best bet out of Tashkent going east.

name: Isuzu service
description:
Large workshop specialized in servicing the Isuzu buses, so they know about diesel.
Once we mentioned our problem with a diesel leak on our tank, others workshops threw their hands up in the air and directed us to here, including the DNM motors down the road mentioned elsewhere (this road is where all car mechanics setup shop in Samarkand, so lots of other possibilities for servicing, tyre repair, etc.). 
Nice welcome, they went to work almost immediately, not afraid to unmount and weld our tank. Good work, laid-down atmosphere. Serious guys.

name: Hotel Gul Zamin Sayqal
description:
Pretty substandard hotel compared to other options nearby, BUT: there is room for 4 cars inside the courtyard, with height clearing of around 2m80, so our landcruiser with roof top tent could fit. Big rigs and campers no-no. Bikers could find better options elsewhere. 
Rooms are drab and not very comfy, but there is hot shower and a/c. 10$ pp with breakfast. 
Popular with locals, so call ahead. 
Access is right across from Registan: follow the lane and turn left, hotel is 30 m further. 
Tel:
+998 91 519 21 77
+998 91 557 40 30
+998 66 235 26 91

name: Fuel station with petrol and diesel
description:
Diesel no problem, 10000/l
Old red pump is serving diesel
Take credit cards too !

name: COVID testing
description:
PCR test available here, needed in April 2022 for crossing into Kazakhstan.
95’000 soms pp. (env. 8.5$)

name: Sofram
description:
Turkish restaurant. Prices are higher than elsewhere but still reasonable. Nice change if you’re tired from the plov-laghman-kebab routine. 
A/C.

name: Underground mosque
description:
Just follow the local tourists from the parking. 
But if by chance you’re alone, here are the coordinates.

name: Sand beach
description:
Nice flat area on hard ground next to a sand beach.
Not much protection from wind, though.
Access on a dirt track, ok for a Lada, not sure about a big rig though.

name: Drive auto parts
description: Good selection of auto parts, one of the guy speaks some English, so that’s a bonus.

name: Car bazaar
description: Many shops selling auto parts. Good place to shop around.

name: New Customs Office
description:
Disregard the other customs office nearby, this is where you need to go for the vehicle importation papers. 
We got 3 months at the border, apparently it’s the new norm. They told us we could extend at the customs in Aktau, but it turns out it’s not so simple, in 2022. 
They told us there had been so many cars imported illegally that they’re changing the rules. They won’t extend our permit to 12 months as requested.
After some discussions, we got a document allowing us to keep the car here for 1 year. First they wanted us to store it at a customs car park, but it didn’t suit us. Next idea was a declaration from a local resident where our car will be parked, and that did the trick. 
Best avoid Kazakhstan for long term storage, for now.

name: Beket Ata
description:
Yet another underground mosque, but this one is the most famous. Now there’s even an excellent tarmac up to here. 
The mosque itself isn’t so interesting, but it’s nice to visit anyway.
Note that it’s 200 m down from the car park, so when it’s hot be prepared and bring some water and a hat. 
Men should wear long pants and shoes, women need to cover their shoulders and legs and wear a scarf to enter the mosque.

name: Khiva moon
description: Outside of the old city and thus cheaper as inside of the old city. Delicious food and english menu. Nice garden.

name: European oil change center
description:
Across the street from the Rohat Hostel/Hotel is a oil service center with European oils such as Liqui-Moly and Castrol. The oils are sold for a good rate and the service is one dollar, although they didn't charge us for that.

They have car, truck and motorcycle oil.

The owner speaks good English, he told us he lived in the USA for half a year.

name: Hotel Kungrad
description: great Family hotel. AC, clean, bath atached and home made food. Really kind and helpfull. 1 night one oerson 150.000 son, 13 euros aprox.

name: Renat Moto Service
description:
Best Moto service in the city! Father and son, can work on big bikes as well! Prices are good, very friendly! They are well connected in case you need anything from Almaty or Osh. 

Telegram / WhatsApp number : +998 90 560 21 06 . 

Speak a little bit of English but with translate app no problem!

name: Khiva Khan Hotel (WhatsApp Contact)
description:
Brand new hotel run by a lovely family with the young adult son speaking very good English and running the hotel for the most part. Good breakfast included in the price, comfortable beds, air conditioning and ensuite in each room. The citadel is a very short walk and restaurants and cafes are nearby. Very pet friendly, we stayed with 3 dogs and the family made us feel very much at home.

WhatsApp number: +998919991118

name: Uy-Joy Kommunal Xo'Jaligi
description: very basic accommodation, stinky out toilets outside and hose shower. over priced at 200,000 a room but maybe you can negotiate, we were just too tired. Good for a night of late but would rather camp.

name: Lang Co
description:
Traditional Vietnamese village by a beautiful beach.
Try the banh boc loc (a sort of prawn dumpling).

name: Beach House Resort and Campground
description:
110 K p. Pax to pitch up your tent
Also Bungalows available 625 K p. Night
Or you can rent a tent

name: CoCo Beachcamp
description: 1$ to pitch up your tent. Nice Location at at the beach with reasonable prices for food. Cheap drinks. Free large beer for give a good Review on TripAdvisor and Google. Loud music in the night / DJ.

name: Saint Mary Beach Resort
description: Cozy location at the beach. Pitch up your tent for 150 K p. Pax and enjoy pool and sea. There are also bungalow's available.

name: Green Laundry Vietnam
description:
ADMIN NOTE: please be aware that this place has been submitted by a stakeholder of the place.

Green Laundry is specialises in cleaning clothes, blankets, towels, soft toys and also provide a reliable dry cleaning service. They offer a professional service which aims to help you save time and money.

Green Laundry offer free pick -up and delivery for customers within 4kms of one of their two locations. If you live outside the delivery range, the delivery cost will depend on the size of your washing load.

Green Laundry Danang gives you the best price and convenience in Danang. Just call their friendly staff and pick up will be arranged within minutes. They pick-up from 7.30am until 5.30pm and will return your clothes on the same day. After 5.30pm, delivery will be the following morning.

Branch 1: 20 Duong Tu Minh Street, An Hai Bac ward, Son Tra district, Da Nang city, Vietnam
Branch 2: 173 Nguyen Van Thoai Street, An Hai Dong ward, Son Tra district, Da Nang city, Vietnam

name: Vietnam phuot homestay
description:
very nice homestay with secure bike parking. ~150.000vnd for dorm.
lovely family, sign up for dinner!
