a bit hard to find, it's not visible from the road, take the mini dirttrack or the slightly bigger track further north. usually people know what you are looking for and point the way when you stand at the road with a big question mark :)

name: little ferry
description:
you can avoid highway 1 while following the coast if you take these two ferries. only bikes can cross the little island.

ferry seems to be free (or i missed the spot to pay)

name: fishing village
description: a little fishing village outside of hoi an, come here in the early morning (sunrise, 5:30 am?) when the  fishermen arrive and the market ladies fight for the best catch. good photo opportunities!

name: Nguyen nhi hotel
description:
nice centrally located hotel, 200k for a single room.
i like this city, very local, basically no tourists

name: broken bridge
description: nice spot for photos or just to have a break. when going north the turnoff is about 50m before the new highway bridge. if you miss it you need to do long u-turn drives (same if you are going south). wish i had a drone...

name: yen house
description:
good place to stay in can tho, if you're on a very big bike the small parking space might be a bit of a squeeze but the lovely owner (Yen) will try to make it work.

yen speaks good English and likes traveling herself, get some recommendations from her!

name: phap buu pagoda
description: randomly came across this unusual structure, the temple itself is not overly interesting, but there is an old lady that used to have a G.I. boyfriend. her English is limited but she is really lovely and will most likely approach you once spotted. she is taking care of the temple since many years so she will probably be around. they also take care of two young orphans there, that's the main reason mentioning this place, good people, if you're passing through say hello, maybe bring some gift or put some money in the donation box...

name: da dia reef
description: some cool black rock formations, unfortunately huge tourism infrastructure around it, entry 20k.

name: Mui Ne police trap
description:
long story short: police in Mui Ne area started to take big bribes from motorcycling backpackers, someone higher up didn't like it and cracked down hard on the corrupt police, since then instead of taking a bribe for the various violations (not many have a license valid in Vietnam...) they started to follow the law and are now impounding the bikes.

two friends got trough without big trouble, one was stopped and threatened with bike impounding but was eventually let go.

still, if you should have "inofficially imported" your bike or have no valid license (only IDP 1968 agreement) you might want to go around this area.

more info here: https://www.tigitmotorbikes.com/mui-ne-police-sand-dune-trap/

name: Trai Hoa Vang
description:
like a boutique hotel with a lot of love for detail, amazing staff/family.

single room 250k
i think i almost never had such a nice place for that money.

name: Truong son dong road - under construction
description:
the spectacular road continues north, it's not yet on any maps but you can reach DT616.

a good part of the way is paved but about 25km in the middle are not and can be challenging or blocked due to landslides/construction. at one point i had to go over a steep mountain track to get around a landslide. okay with my CRF in dry condition, not sure how/if a Chinese win would do ^^

name: huong danh homestay
description:
nice homestay with friendly family, 100k per night. go for a walk in the village / to the bridge.

simple dinner 50k

fast wifi

name: Gió Lào Eco Lodge
description:
great biker stop in the tea hills.
group accommodation ~150k, dinner 80k

name: An Binh
description: good place to stay in Phong Nha, 200k a night without breakfast, spacious rooms and a bit of a view.

name: Trang an for you homestay
description: beautiful sunset spot, the homestay seems nice too but i didn't stay (700k for bungalow, ~150k dorm)

name: Hoanh Homestay
description:
nice homestay in beautiful area. 
great food and views. lovely owner.

100k / night shared room
150k dinner
50k breakfast
10-15k beer

name: Ta Xua hills
description: beautiful stay in the mountains, lovely people, cold beers and excellent food. dorm 90k, private bungalows available, dinner from 60k. when in town look for the sign to ta xua hills.

name: songanh hotel
description:
nice views from room and rooftop. centrally located and good parking.
350k/night for two, bargain!

owner friendly enough, but better keep your passport and pay in advance, didn't like how it was just openly lying around between other stuff.

name: Pu sam cap cave
description: Beautiful cave. 35k with parking.

name: bui sanh homestay
description:
what an experience!
highly recommend.
50k sleeping
100k dinner
200k herbal bath and massage (do it)

name: Te Xua - The Dinosaur Spine
description:
a famous ~30cm wide path with massive drops to both sides. 
Usually people walk there but it recently became a "crazy thing to do" for bikers.
it's very steep just before the spine, don't even think about it on rainy weather. you have to be a bit suicidal to try this, absolutely no room for error.
I had to give it a pass on my CRF250L.
I was told one guy went down already but surprisingly survived.

name: Rough road
description:
20-30km of very rough road with big rocks, water crossings and mud, might be impassable at times.
In the wet some downhill sections become very slippery. 

locals avoid this road and go all the way around to head north.

it's a very beautiful road though, best not to do alone, might take very long to get help.

name: Tien Quan Homestay
description:
great place to stay, very clean, super friendly family and hands down the best food I had in two months Vietnam.

hard matresses :)

dorm 80k
food 120k

name: nha nghi viet bac - HOT SPRINGS
description:
very nice hotsprings in a beautiful area that has yet to see tourism.

accommodation isn't great and a bit overpriced but you can try to camp as well. room 300k for two. dinner so so (100k)

name: Homestay nhà nghỉ Minh Châu Sơn La
description:
Big dormitory, 80k/pax. Very friendly owners. Best dinner in Vietnam, 70k/pax.
Only for treckers or bikers as the access is a very strong and narrow bridge.

name: Flat and grassy campspot near the river
description: just after the village, take the track on the left which go down to the river. River, flat spot and nice view at the morning ! We saw few people at the morning, friendly. It's close to the road but quiet during the night

name: Amazingly cheap bakery
description: Amazing Bakery where we found good bred, pain brioché, chouquettes and others french style délices. incredibly cheap ! and delicious

name: Japanese Bridge
description: Famous walking bridge located in the center of Hoi An. Scenic, especially at night with boats and lanterns floating down the river. A must see when visiting Hoi An.

name: Eco Cafe
description: Well priced menu. Delicious egg burgers for breakfast. Hit the spot after weeks of noodle soup. Good coffee and milkshakes. Kids are happy. Meals 40,000-120,000vnd. Drinks 30,000-50.000vnd

name: Face lake hanoi. Very quiet.
description: Lakefront location overlooking Hanoi.  grassy field, or Vietnamese come night and day for the sight, fishing and sleeping in their car.  quite quiet place, quiet and without problem.  good option for overlanlander. All frer

name: Resort and beach
description: pretty beach.  we asked the resort which accepted that we camp in its enclosure but otherwise there are sand dunes in front.  Do not come on weekends because the resort is full.  shower, water and sandy beach.  very good spot and we did not pay anything.

name: Aristo Hotel
description: Three star rooms and breakfast with a restaurant.

name: Thanh Dat 2 Hotel
description:
We found this hotel after a long cycling day. The place is close to a train station, in a quiet area. A very nice family runs the place, and even not speaking english they are always helpful and manage to comunicate using google translator. The room was clean and comfortable, with AC. The toilet and shower is good (hot water). We paid 8USD for a private double bed room, no breakfast included. There is wifi (okay, not fast).
We could park our bicycle in the garage. I think there is also space for big cars.

name: Vegetarian - Lien Huong
description: A very good vegetarian restaurant and nice people. Delicious noodle soup  and pasta Bolognese- 30k each. We highly recommend! The neighbourhood is also nice and worth a walk.

name: Hanoi Taco Bar
description: Delicious tacos, enchiladas and margaritas.  Nice surprise in a cool part of Hanoi

name: Jungle Camp
description:
we first drove a little road and then a really small road to this amazing jungle camp 

you are in the middle of the jungle 
dont arrive too late, because it is dark very fast

at evening it becomes humid but definitely worth the jungle camp

name: The Big Man Restaurant
description: You can’t go wrong on this menu. Every meal we picked was delicious and they even catered for our littlest son who is an extremely fussy eater. Decent prices great service. Highly recommend for backpackers and families alike.

name: Supercenter
description: Supermarket where you can find anything you need.

name: Holy grail!
description:
MODERATORS NOTE: Vehicle access not sure (maybe motorbike or small 4x4) 

This is a great spot! Perfectly flat ground, off the road, quiet. 

About 30kms from na meo.

name: Basic , but decent hotel
description:
The hotel is a little old and worn but good enough! 200,000dong for 2 people - 1 room with private bathroom. Shower is hot. Beds firm.

We ate here and paid 120,000dong for pork rice and vegetables - food was good.

In the morning you can buy banh my for 40,000.

They will exchange money Vietnamese dong to Laos kip.

Owner is nice and speaks English! 

Good place.

name: Border to Laos
description:
From 2020 you cannot get your visa at the border. 

You need to get a visa from the Laos embassy in Hanoi.

name: Indian restaurant
description:
Serves Indian food, Laotion good, great breakfasts and vegetarian dishes. 
Staff are very polite! Book exchange, money exchange and SIM cards all available here.

name: Cave Tour - a must see!
description:
60,000/person with a brilliant audio guide. 

Tour caves as they were used in the war, hear stories from real people and understand a little of the history and the war in Laos. 

A truly fantastic experience - genuinely the best tourist attraction I’ve been to.

It was so quiet when we went - just the three of us wondering around.

name: Street Parking
description:
you can stay on this corner for the night.
street is noisy but it's free

name: street parking
description:
Sidewalk parking, noisy neighborhood, lots of free parking spaces.

stationnement sur le trottoir, quartier bruyant, pais peu de lieux gratuits pour stationner

name: Anh Nguyen Hoang Gia Motel
description: Simple, cheap family run hotel. Rooms are new, clean, air con, hot water, quiet and pleasant. Courtyard for secure parking. Run by lovely people and Anh speaks some English. Single room was 160k VND in April 2019, excellent value.

name: Canh Duong
description:
Lovely hotel - immaculately clean and great value. Owners speak great English. 

Double room, 1 night 250,000. You can find this hotel on booking.com but it’s 10% cheaper to turn up. 

If you want food they can serve you instant noodles and egg which is 20,000/head.

Breakfast is addition - 30,000/head approximately (it depends what you want). Breakfast is a choice of eggs with bread.

There are a couple downsides - the bed is very very firm! The wifi is good but not great.

name: Silver Moon Villa
description:
Great English speaking owner. 300dong/night with breakfast. Room are clean and comfortable. Air con in room. 

Bikes available from the hotel. Pool. 

Hoi an sights just a short walk away.

Would stay again!

name: Las Vegas Coffe and Tea
description: Good place to stop for coffee and boba. Wifi shows up but I didnt try it.

name: Hanoi Photo Shop
description: One good Shop for making Pictures for Passport and Visa in Hanoi.
